Job Summary:
Chemical or Mechanical Engineering Co-Op Opportunity
2020-2021 Recruiting Cycle

Dow is currently seeking an exceptional Engineering student for a Co-op opportunity in Manufacturing and Engineering (M&E). 
 
Engineering students work as part of a team to address challenging, real-world problems.-We combine world-class expertise, future-focused technologies, and sustainability to solve global issues in the areas of energy, consumerism, health and nutrition, infrastructure and transportation. 

Co-op opportunities include a broad range of responsibilities within the chemical and-mechanical engineering disciplines.
Job Responsibilities:
Dow Chemical Canada has an exciting opportunity for  a Chemical or Mechanical Co-Op Engineers at the Fort Saskatchewan plant site for a 8-month term.
The Chemical or Mechanical Engineer Co-op will be joining the Fort Saskatchewan site as part of the Energy Systems/Infrastructure Improvement team.  Responsibilities will likely include such items as production troubleshooting and problem solving, preventative maintenance, yield improvements, waste reduction. Opportunities include a broad range of responsibilities in chemical plant safety and environmental performance, process operation, optimization, modification, reliability, and technology implementation.  Engineers must use sound technical judgment to enable safe and efficient plant operations. Our Engineering students work as part of an elite team and have many opportunities to address challenging real-world problems.
Required Skills:
Preferred Qualifications:

Prefer student that has completed their 3rd or 4th year of academic studies.
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Outstanding work ethic and leadership potential
Active participation and leadership in extracurricular activities and on-campus organizations

 
Required Qualifications: 

Working towards a Bachelor's Degree in Chemical or Mechanical Engineering is required.
Must have a minimum overall cumulative 2.700 GPA (on a 4.000 scale) or equivalent on a 100% scale at your current Canadian based university.
Successful applicants are subject to a background check, as a standard part of Dow's hiring process.
Reliable attendance is an expectation of every Dow employee, therefore the successful student must be able to provide their own accommodation, and have their own reliable transportation to the plant site daily. Our plant sites are not on public transportation routes.
All applicants must be legally authorized to work in Canada without company support or sponsorship or have a valid current Canadian Work Permit to be considered for this opening.

This position is posted as a Co-Op Student position for growth and professional development of the student, as well as evaluation by Dow for the potential for future hire.

Job Summary:
YOUR NEXT CO-OP PLACEMENT - Technical Specialist, Communications
 
From classroom to co-op to career, every step of your journey has an impact on your future. That's why it makes sense to choose a co-op placement with a company that offers truly rewarding work and real-life experience. At Economical Insurance®, your contributions, creativity, and energy will be put to good use, and you'll get to be involved with initiatives that support our strategic goals and use your skills in a supportive team environment.
 
Our family of companies includes Sonnet, the only Canadian home and auto insurer offering a fully online buying experience, and Petline, the largest Canadian pet insurance company. We're also preparing to become a publicly traded company, a once-in-a-lifetime career opportunity for everyone who joins our team.
 
If you're looking for a company that takes care of its people - full time, part time, and co-ops alike - and has a track record of doing big things, get ready to love it here.
Job Responsibilities:
What can you expect in this role?
As a Technical Specialist Communications in Technology Solutions, you specialize in writing and editorial services for Technology Solutions (TS) employees, TS leaders and internal business customers, including supporting:

Strategic communications for TS projects, programs and initiatives (drafting and implementing communications plans for new processes and tools for internal customers)
Leadership reporting (business slides and management reports)
Town Hall messaging, TS Events, and Newsletter/online articles
Creation of consistent and compelling TS messaging across various communication platforms (Confluence, Microsoft Office, SharePoint, Email)
Facilitation of information sharing, knowledge and expertise within the TS organization through the development and management of communication vehicles and promotion of good communication practice
As an influencer, provides communication guidance and support for TS and project teams, ensuring critical (technical and non-technical) information is shared to the right people, at the right time, with the appropriate level of detail               
Collaborates with TS team members to ensure deliverables (such as work instructions or communications) align to corporate branding, processes, and writing guidelines            
Plans and prioritizes tasks to ensure effective and efficient delivery of knowledge-related deliverables            
Participates in governance forums as required and ensures follow-up items are completed in alignment with the target requirements and business priority          
Validates completeness and accuracy of knowledge-related deliverables and confirm outcomes have met the requirements       
As a communication and knowledge resource, provides insight and recommendations based on industry and technology trends, technology strategy, and experience with team members      
Builds relationships with business and TS partners across all teams, working collaboratively to identify solutions and resolve issues
Required Skills:
What you bring to the role?

Enrolled in Undergraduate degree in English, Business, Computer Science or related discipline      
Coop experience in communications or technical writing role   
Experience assessing communication options for the implementation, decommissioning, or upgrade of a technical solution or service; analyzing, reviewing, and providing options, recommendations, and guidance to team members
Sound knowledge of communication best practices, project delivery practices, and writing standards for socializing technical processes, services, and tools                    
Ability to work independently developing communication plans, and executing project tasks and deliverables (multi-tasking), with minimal supervision            
Developing subject matter expert in communications and knowledge management who advises the project team on best practices, including industry trends                 

We also take potential into consideration. If you don't have this exact experience, but you know you have what it takes, be sure to give us more insight through your application and cover letter.

Go ahead and expect a lot - you deserve it!

We're also preparing to become a publicly traded company, a once-in-a-lifetime career opportunity for everyone who joins our team.
 
If you're looking for a company that takes care of its people - full time, part time, and co-ops alike - and has a track record of doing big things, get ready to love it here.
Job Responsibilities:
Quality Assurance is a highly strategic and challenging area of our IT business that deals with the validation and verification of software systems and data.  Economical Insurance is seeking a technical Student in Quality Assurance to join us in this important area.

You are a student of a Computer Science or related program.  You want to work in an Agile team in a professional environment and expand your skills on a project that matters.  You are willing to get your hands dirty both testing and/or coding.  Your programming skills and expertise in software are impeccable.
This is a technical role, spans multiple technology spaces, and offers a good opportunity to gain and apply experience in a range of systems supporting multiple projects and infrastructures.  The successful candidate will be involved with identifying test scenarios, creating and executing test cases and potentially writing automated test scripts.

You'll be working closely with the Quality Engineering team that operates in an Agile environment, working on initiatives that span the business to implement common QA, DevOps, and Development goals.

Job Responsibilities

Analyzing requirements in order to identify and create test scenarios
Designing, creating and executing manual tests
Designing and scripting automated regression tests
Testing data seeding, data masking and data analysis
Analysis and reporting of testing results
Working in an Agile environment to achieve the highest possible quality standards and improve current QE capabilities
Required Skills:
Working toward bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science or related field
Knowledge of CS fundamentals including data structures, algorithm design and complexity analysis
Experience with consuming RESTful APIs an asset
Understanding of the manipulation of XML and XSD Schemas an asset
Proficiency working with JSON, XML, CSV data formats
Hands on skill and utilization of SQL for the querying of relational data
Experience in web technologies such as HTML, CSS, Javascript
Proficiency in at least one programming language such as Java, C++ or Python
Hands on exposure to Test Automation Frameworks / Test Harness an asset
Excellent analytical and problem solving skills
Experience with Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery concepts and approaches an asset
Understanding of and experience with DevOps an asset
Experience and understanding of Agile software development methodologies
Strong English communication skills  both verbal and written

Go ahead and expect a lot you deserve it.

Job Summary:
YOUR NEXT CO-OP PLACEMENT - Actuarial Analyst - Corporate Actuarial
 
From classroom to co-op to career, every step of your journey has an impact on your future. That's why it makes sense to choose a co-op placement with a company that offers truly rewarding work and real-life experience. If you're looking for a company that takes care of its people - full time, part time, and co-ops alike - and has a track record of doing big things, get ready to love it here.
Job Responsibilities:
Reporting to the Team Leader, Corporate Actuarial, the Actuarial Analyst is responsible for the timely completion of data collection and analyses associated with financial planning, reserving, catastrophe exposure monitoring and/or, where necessary, other risk management work of Economical Insurance and its insurance subsidiaries.  The analyst will be expected to work collaboratively both within and outside of the Corporate Actuarial department, building good working relationships with numerous areas such as Finance, Risk Management, and Pricing & Analytics.

 Emphasis on learning various actuarial operations and the insurance business
 Develop and apply professional experience with spreadsheets, databases, and statistical software to compile and categorize data used in pricing, reserving and profitability analysis
 Learn to communicate basic actuarial concepts to other actuaries both verbally and in writing
 Produces various data exhibits and analysis relating to measuring, tracking, and monitoring company and industry performance
 Responds to routine requests of internal and external stakeholders related to standard reports and processes with validation from more senior staff
Required Skills:
Currently enrolled in an Actuarial Science, Math, or Statistics degree program
 Must have completed 2 to 4 exams of the Casualty Actuarial Society
 Must have excellent communication and organizational skills
 Must possess strong programming skills, including efficient use of Microsoft applications (Excel, Access, VBA, etc.)
 Knowledge of SAS, R or Python is an asset

Go ahead and expect a lot - you deserve it.

Job Summary:
LOVE WHAT YOU DO 

Work is a big part of our lives, so it makes sense to choose a company that offers truly rewarding work. At Economical Insurance®, your contributions, creativity, and energy won't go to waste. Our passionate culture and pioneering mentality infuse everything we do, which is why our one-million-plus policyholders know we'll protect their homes, businesses, farms, cars, and pets like they're our own.

We're not afraid to see how far we can push the envelope to make insurance better. Our family of companies includes Sonnet, the only Canadian home and auto insurer offering a fully online buying experience, and Petline, the largest Canadian pet insurance company. We're also preparing to become a publicly traded company, a once-in-a-lifetime career opportunity for everyone who joins our team.

If you're looking for a company that takes care of its people - and its customers - and has a track record of doing big things, get ready to love it here.

What can you expect in this role?

The Opportunity - Technology Business Coordinator Co-op: Reporting to the AVP, Strategy and Planning and receiving day-to-day coaching and guidance from Technology Business Partners, and Process Analysts. You'll work collaboratively with various technology teams to assist with strategic planning, process improvements, and help provide technical solutions that are of value to our business partners.

Create and maintain new and existing intake requests through JIRA & Clarity
Clarity and JIRA intake request tracking and reporting
Liaise with business partners to identify and define problem statements and objectives to achieve desired customer outcome
Provide 2021 Strategic Planning support and consolidation of all requests
Manage a project to refresh our SharePoint communication portal / document repository for Technology Business Planning and Process Improvement teams
Creation and/or updating of executive PowerPoint presentations
Chair meetings, take & distribute minutes to all team members and stakeholders
Keep the Technology Business Partner or Process Analyst apprised of any emerging issues as they arise that may impact our customer
Required Skills:
Who We Are Looking for:

Self-driven, able to move tasks & requests forward independently and with personal accountability
Team player and excellent collaborator, able to both lead & participate to develop solutions with strong customer focus
Detailed orientated, organized and resourceful
Adaptive and Agile, able to rapidly pivot your efforts between multiple priorities as business needs change to provide value to our customers

Qualifications

Previous experience working in a technology solution environment is an asset
Previous experience working in an Agile/Scrum environment is an asset
Proficient in MS Office 365 (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and MS Teams is an asset
Experience with SharePoint, JIRA, ServiceNow & Clarity (CA PPM) is an asset

We also take potential into consideration. If you don't have this exact experience, but you know you have what it takes, be sure to give us more insight through your application and cover letter.

If you're looking for a company that takes care of its people - full time, part time, and co-ops alike - and has a track record of doing big things, get ready to love it here.
Job Responsibilities:
What can you expect in this role?
Provide analytical support and oversight to improve the operational effectiveness of Commercial Insurance across head office, regional, segment and RPC business units. Provides forward thinking analysis, direction to promote and instill consistently effective alignment and execution across the Commercial Insurance operations.

Data Acquisition / Planning
 - Provides financial and data analysis in support of Commercial priorities with a primary focus on analytics and data mining to support analysis and informed action
 - Work closely with Operations Leads across the country to perform data and market analysis to support business insight development
 - Support Commercial Region/Segment Leadership in obtaining timely, relevant metrics in an efficient manner to limit duplication of work with CI Operational lead roles
 - Identify and champion improvements in data structure and automated reporting to align to current Commercial Lines pricing strategies and KPI segmentation
 
Business Analysis
- Participates in Commercial Initiatives covering but not limited to product definition, financial performance and profitability trending to define requirements and provide data led insights for analysis and action.
- Supports Commercial analysts to identify and leverage efficiency opportunities covering automation and scripting technology
- Supports weekly, monthly, quarterly reporting requirements with timely, actionable data following logical exploration on emerging trends where applicable
- Participates in review of operational process workflows to highlight and address inefficiencies with data supported actions and expected results

Operational Oversight
- Supports CI Operations in managing the roadmap for CI initiatives (e.g., KPI measurement enhancements, Process improvements and alignment) - including risks / issues, reporting on progress against milestones.
- Supports governance and oversight of CI initiative tracking, communication and escalations.
 
Business Controls
- Provides specialized measurement, reporting and support to ensure awareness and governance across Commercial insurance.
- Collaborates with Operations (and various other departments) to measure progress and adherence to applicable regulatory and governance issues.
Required Skills:
What do you bring to the role?
- Ability to use data to help form decisions from an execution perspective
- Exceptional customer service, verbal and written communication skills
- Analytical focus and statistical background would be considered an asset
- Strong working knowledge of Microsoft suite products (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, etc.)
- Tableau and SAS experience would be considered an asset
- Great attention to detail, proactive and responsive to short deadlines

Job Summary:
The Empire Life Insurance Company (Empire Life) offers individual and group life and health insurance, investment and retirement products. Our mission is to make it simple, fast and easy for Canadians to get the investment, insurance and group benefits coverage they need to build wealth, generate income, and achieve financial security. 
 
We want you to join our innovation lab and its fast-paced, and passionate engineering team to change the industry.  Ideate, build, and test innovative solutions which will lead the digital insurance market.   We recently launched an award-winning industry-first full online life insurance application and we're just getting started - with many more exciting projects in the pipeline.  The Empire Lab is developing a lean and highly collaborative work environment in our new Toronto space.  Be part of accelerating the daily evolution of this storied company.  Develop your skills on an evolving team with the excitement and freedom of a well-funded start-up but supported with industry expert guidance.  Our size and history position us well to innovate in our chosen markets while being nimble and minimizing bureaucracy.  Help Empire continue to lead the way in insurtech / fintech. 
 
Empire Life welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities.  Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the screening and selection process.

Co-op developers have a unique opportunity to explore emerging technologies through generating ideas, requesting funding and stopping projects based on your market learning.
Job Responsibilities:
You will learn, apply and experience the innovation process and lean concept development by:
Aiding in ideation to solve real market problems
Designing, prototyping and testing ideas with customers, in the actual market
Answering critical business questions by collecting real market data
Rapidly develop your solution concept into functional prototypes (for web and/or mobile)
Investigate the potential of new and emerging technologies (e.g. big data, platform features, AI)
Refine presentation skills by pitching concepts and demos to senior executives
Learn and share developer insights with other teams and partners
Gain experience making real business process improvement through digitization
Opportunity to work as part of a dynamic, agile team to delivering cutting edge digital transformation online
Contribute to building proof of concept and exploratory work for an API and services-enabled application architecture, and to deliver interconnected capabilities through a distributed digital ecosystem
Work closely with digital marketing experts to assess and analyze supporting technologies, data and patterns
Research and try out innovative solutions and approaches, challenge existing scenarios and brainstorm new techniques
Work remotely, but connected via Slack, chat, Google Hangouts, etc.
Participate in daily team hangouts
Required Skills:
Tech Stack
Team adopts a loosely hyper-agile methodology and uses the latest DevOps tools including:
Slack - our team's main communications channel.  We also use Slack bots of all shapes and sizes to automate our processes
GitHub
Jira - planning and tracking work
CircleCI - automated behat testing and Continuous Integration and Deployment
Dynamic Dev, Staging and Prod regions
Amazon EC2, S3 and Heroku
Languages include: Node, React, Django, Flask, Python, Drupal/PHP, Java and others

Job Summary:
The Fitting Room marketplace is looking to create a paradigm shift in apparel commerce by powering on-demand, custom-fit garment production at scale. Using computer vision, machine learning and 3D visualization, we replicate the real life bespoke clothing shopping experience, virtually. Vendors are able to upload their designs to our marketplace, then with their mobile device customers are able to create a 3D avatar of themselves,  and customize outfits.

In the backend, our algorithm changes the proportions of the garment to fit the customer's body shape, while taking into account the designer's intended look and fit of the garment. The customer is then able to virtually try on the garment to see the photorealistic drape of the final product.

Currently, The Fitting Room is looking for a Co-op student to fill a Full Stack Software Engineer role. Must have experience in React, Node and GraphQL.
Job Responsibilities:
- Build, maintain and grow the platform.
- Be part of initial development, support and build features to the existing platform. 
- Handle added responsibilities and be part of a growing team. 
- Work in a team with quick turnaround time and make decisions regarding implementation with minimal direction.
Required Skills:
Deep understanding of React.js, Node.js with experience working in GraphQL. 
Working understanding of Docker, Kubernetes, and Azure (or AWS). 
Experience in building microservices. 
Ability to write clean code with proper documentation. 
Ability to work in dynamic team environments. 
Motivation to be an integral part of a growing team and affinity towards working in a start-up environment.

Job Summary:
Our Mission

The Globe and Mail Data Science team's mission is to help the organization make sense of the terabytes of data that is generated by our publishing platforms. We are extending and enhancing our analytical capabilities so that our editorial team is better equipped to answer questions such as: What type of content should we produce more of? Which content is better placed behind the paywall? When is a good time to publish new content?
 
Your work will be critical in helping our editorial team with their storytelling to better serve our millions of Canadian readers.
 
Successful applicants will work at our new downtown office, located by Toronto's Distillery District. Other benefits include team building activities, casual work attire and an innovative working environment.
8 month work term is preferred, but we are open to accepting applications for a 4 month term 

Who are you?

You enjoy collaborating with others to build something from nothing
You are data savvy and have a knack for manipulating terabytes of data
You aspire to be a data architect and like getting your hands dirty by building data pipelines
You are self-directed and have the desire to explore and learn new technologies
You thrive in a fast-paced environment and can deliver results quickly through iteration
Job Responsibilities:

collecting, processing and storing terabytes of data for use by analysts, data scientists and other stakeholders around the company
building and maintaining data APIs to support new features for our in-house analytics suite of tools
collaborating with our data scientists and data engineers to develop new approaches to solidify our ETL processes
monitoring and improving performance of ETL processes

experience writing APIs and knowledge of API best practices
experience with SQL and NoSQL databases (e.g., Elasticsearch, Postgres, Redis)

Job Summary: The successful candidate will work in the academic research group of Dr. Stephen Scherer, embedded within The Centre for Applied Genomics (TCAG) at SickKids hospital in downtown Toronto. This group has a major focus on the genetics and genomics of autism spectrum disorder (ASD) and related neurodevelopmental conditions, grounded in previous work on analysis of whole genome sequencing data. The student will work under the direct supervision of a postdoctoral fellow, within a highly experienced team of bioinformaticians from a diverse set of backgrounds. This position represents an opportunity to contribute to the development of novel methods for analysis of genome-wide data, including network and pathway analysis, and/or application of machine learning methods to identify genomic features from whole genome sequence data. We are accepting students requiring either 4- or 8-month work terms.
Job Responsibilities: This position will entail working on methodologies and pipelines for whole genome analysis, under the supervision of an experienced mentor. Tasks may include writing scripts for parsing data; construction, maintenance and/or testing of analytical pipelines; methods development for novel approaches to network/pathway analysis; methods development for novel applications of machine learning to whole-genome sequence data; or other tasks as required.

Proficiency in programming is desired. Thorough knowledge of a scripting language such as Python or Perl will be extremely helpful.
Practical working knowledge of R / Bioconductor is desirable.
Experience working with genomic data, particularly genome sequence data (and preferably from human samples) will be an asset.
Advanced knowledge of statistics would be a "nice to have" additional skill.
A thorough grounding in genetics/genomics and/or molecular biology would be a desirable asset, as would practical experience working in a research laboratory performing molecular biology techniques.
Experience in human genetics is preferable.

Division: The Peter Gilgan Centre for Research and Learning
Job Summary: The placenta is vital to successful pregnancy, as it ensures the supply of oxygen and nutrients to the developing fetus. The candidate will work on the development and validation of a magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) method for visualizing utero-placental vasculature and quantifying placental blood flow. Many major pregnancy complications, which contribute significantly to fetal morbidity/mortality and lifelong challenges are linked to placental blood flow abnormalities. The proposed technique for non-invasive blood flow evaluation (without the use of potentially harmful contrast agents) may therefore lead to refinements in the treatment and management of affected pregnancies and improved birth outcomes.
Job Responsibilities:
The candidate will be responsible for refining and validating the acquisition technique, which employs a radial acquisition with a continuous radiofrequency shift (aka SWEEP) to create multi-slice, flow sensitive data. The candidate will also optimize a reconstruction pipeline (in Python) for these unique data.
 
Initial tests of accuracy and feasibility will be performed on an MRI compatible, programmable flow pump system (CardioFlow 5000, Shelley Medical Inc) and on healthy adult subjects. Once validated, the technique will be applied to healthy, late gestation (>35 wks) pregnant subjects.
 
Innovative aspects of this work will include MRI pulse sequence development, reconstruction of undersampled (i.e. sub-Nyquist) non-Cartesian MRI acquisitions, and analysis of multi- dimensional blood flow data.
Required Skills: The candidate should be adept at image and signal processing (or, ideally, have previous experience working with MRI data), and have experience with programming in Python.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:

				MATH - Applied Mathematics

Job Title: Planning/Economic Assistant: Employment Survey, Field Collection
Job Summary:
Dedicated and enthusiastic individuals will be part of a team of 14 students who assist the Planning and Economic Development Branch in updating the annual York Region Employment Survey which tracks employment growth and monitors economic trends in the Region. This survey is one of the most comprehensive surveys of its kind in the GTA and is used to guide regional and local policy formulation through trend analysis relating to business and employment. It also provides existing businesses with decision-making information to assist in locating new stores and facilities.

BENEFITS TO STUDENT

Gain valuable work experience in their field of study.
Apply learned skills in a professional setting.
Enhance their interpersonal and teamwork skills with professionals in the field.
Gain direct experience in the public sector environment and increase knowledge in the Planning & Economic Development field.
Enhance written and oral communication skills.
Job Responsibilities:
Successful candidates will represent both York Region and its 9 local municipalities when performing their duties. A significant amount of time will be spent working independently at home in a virtual environment, gathering data from businesses in York Region through telephone interviews. Data will be collected using a Region-issued tablet and GIS-based software. Candidates will also be required to follow-up with businesses via email or phone and perform quality assurance tasks to ensure continued improvements in accuracy. This position will also involve driving to business areas throughout York Region to collect data and undertake visual checks, as well as office duties in the candidate's home office location in accordance with York Region's COVID-19 staff safety measures.

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES
 

Administrative, Data and Record Keeping Activities:


Assists with the annual Region Employment Survey which tracks employment growth in the Region.
Conducts Employment Survey primarily through virtual tools (telephone, email, or other communication tools), as well as drive to businesses within York Region to conduct visual field checks
Inputs employment data to populate survey data gathered.
Provides support to staff as required.
Maintains electronic and manual records in accordance with Regional standards.
Performs quality assurance checks for accuracy of data.
Assists in the set up and maintenance of the records in the Region Employment Database. 

 


Other Duties:


Performs other duties as assigned in accordance with Branch or Department objectives.
Required Skills:
Currently enrolled on a full-time basis in a University Degree program in Urban Planning, Geography, Business, Economics, or related field.
Returning to school full time in the fall.
Strong communication and customer service skills
Demonstrated ability to organize work, set priorities and meet deadlines
Self-motivated approach to working in both a team environment and on an independent basis.
Detail-oriented approach to accurately collecting and reviewing large datasets.
Computer literacy utilizing MS Office software applications, specifically excel and access.
Working knowledge of GIS and databases is an asset
Familiarity with data quality assurance concepts.
Previous government or business experience an asset
Access to telephone and personal computer technology with video capabilty would be an asset
Knowledge of and demonstrated ability in corporate core competencies including customer service, communication, teamwork, initiative/self-management and accountability, and flexibility/adaptability.

Job Title: Planning/Economic Assistant: Employment Survey, Data Quality Assurance
Job Summary:
Dedicated and enthusiastic individuals will assist the Planning and Economic Development Branch in updating the annual York Region Employment Survey which tracks employment growth and monitors economic trends in the Region. This survey is one of the most comprehensive surveys of its kind in the GTA and is used to guide regional and local policy formulation through trend analysis relating to business and employment. It also provides existing businesses with decision making information to assist in locating new stores and facilities. 

BENEFITS TO STUDENT

Gain valuable work experience in their field of study.
Apply learned skills in a professional setting.
Enhance their interpersonal and teamwork skills with professionals in the field.
Gain direct experience in the public sector environment and increase knowledge in the Planning & Economic Development field.
Enhance written and oral communication skills.
Job Responsibilities:
Successful candidates will represent both York Region and its 9 local municipalities when performing their duties. Reporting to the Manager, Policy, Research & Forecasting, is responsible for assisting the Branch with the biennial York Region Employment Survey. This position includes working from home in a virtual team environment performing quality assurance tasks to ensure the accuracy of data gathered through the field collection process. This includes updating, querying, and analyzing incoming results. Candidates will also contact employers to verify business information via phone or e-mail and may be required to conduct visual, drive by business inspections as well as office duties in the candidate's home office location in accordance with York Region's COVID-19 staff safety measures.

Processes data using FME server.

Job Summary: Reporting to the Program Managers in Water Resources is responsible for performing functions related to compliance and monitoring tasks for production well and aquifer management; assist with on-going projects including field monitoring of water levels at monitoring wells and water quality collection. Also responsible for performing functions related to source water protection including review of development applications, contaminated sites, education and outreach, and working with businesses with potentially significant threats to municipal drinking water sources to help ensure regulatory compliance.

Development Review

Job Summary:
Bioinformatics Technician-Genetics

PI:     Dr. Robert A. Hegele, University of Western Ontario, Robarts Research Institute, Departments of Medicine and Biochemistry

Title:     Bioinformatics analysis of complex data sets

The Hegele lab conducts research into the relationship between genetic variation and clinical measurements in research subjects who are at risk of heart disease, strokes and neurodegenerative conditions, such as Lou Gehrig's and Parkinson diseases. We have multiple data types for each study patient, including a wide range of demographic, clinical and biochemical data, together with data derived from DNA using next-generation DNA sequencing technology.
Job Responsibilities:
Goal:    Maintain and develop an informatics and statistical analysis workflow relevant to human genomic and clinical data. Provide a computer science technical resource to Hegele lab personnel. Perform analysis of high-dimensional data to discover novel relationships between genes and how they affect humans.

We use a bioinformatics workflow to detect where genetic variation (mutations) occurs in a DNA sample. The variant data are then further processed to yield common, associated, as well as rare, pathogenic DNA variants that may contribute to the abnormal levels of blood lipids and increased risk for cardiovascular disease.  The thesis student will assist at all levels of the bioinformatics components of the project and will have the opportunity to see the data analysis in the context of human molecular genetics.
Required Skills:
The co-op student will assist at all levels of the bioinformatics components of the project and will have the opportunity to see the data analysis in the context of human molecular genetics.

Some dimensions of the project: 
1)   Perl, shell, C#, C++, Python, JavaScript, SQL and Unix (CentOS and Ubuntu) programming
2)    update selected genomic databases
3)    manage and implement virtual machine Unix environments on local and server computers
4)    installation, configuration and implementation of bioinformatics tools such as plink,  SKAT-O, EPACTS, GotCloud, ANNOVAR, vcf tools
5)    create novel scripts, updates and improvements to informatics workflows
6)    train lab group, write documentation on protocols, methods and scripts on Hegele lab wiki
7)    new human genome build: help with issues as informatics systems migrate to new version (from GRCh37 to GRCh38)
8)    implementation of a searchable database on Hegele lab web page; Western Database of Lipid Variants to be searchable and queried on Hegele website.

				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				- Theme - Medical Devices and Diagnostics
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science

Job Summary:
The Neuroinformatics S/W Engineer  (2 positions) will work in the Khan and Menon Labs at the Centre for Functional and Metabolic Mapping (http://cfmm.uwo.ca) at Robarts Research Institute, Western University, to build software infrastructure for automating image reconstruction, processing and analyses for magnetic resonance imaging data.  
 
Engineer 1 will build software for interfacing custom image reconstruction with the MRI scanners. Gadgetron (https://github.com/gadgetron/gadgetron) is an open MR reconstruction framework that uses the ISMRMRD (https://github.com/ismrmrd/ismrmrd) open data storage format. In order to fully utilize the open framework, the proprietary closed source manufacturers reconstruction and data formats must be interfaced with the open framework. This requires implementation of data format conversion and client-server communication APIs to allow bi-directional transfer of data between gadgetron and Siemens proprietary systems. The project requires C++ experience in networked client-server communication to develop a fully documented and tested API for communication between gadgetron and Siemens reconstruction. Engineer 2 will add new features to the automated image processing and analysis pipelines (autobids) framework.  The engineer will build web-based interfaces to launch image conversion pipelines, building an interface between the MR image servers and cloud computing resources.  This project requires Python and web-development experience.  Both hires will work with CFMM staff software engineers and scientists, and will gain experience working with neuroimaging data, high-performance computing clusters, workflow engines, and cloud computing.  
 
CFMM is a core western facility. It is located in Western's Robarts Research Institute. CFMM currently has Canada's only collection of high-field (3T human) and ultra-high field (7T human and 9.4T animal) MR systems. The Centre is dedicated to establishing the anatomical, metabolic and functional characteristics of normal brain development and healthy aging across the lifespan; as well as establishing the brain basis of developmental, neuropsychiatric and neurodegenerative deficits.
Job Responsibilities:
- Developing software interfaces to imaging and compute servers
- Working with staff software engineers to help design the software architecture
- Writing and maintaining documentation for developed software
- Building unit and system tests for developed software with continuous integration
- Attending tutorials and learning about neuroimaging
- Meet regularly with team members over zoom/slack/teams
Required Skills:
- C++ or Python programming language (Job 1 / Job 2)
- Software engineering principles
- Knowledge of Linux OS
- Open source software development
- An interest in learning about neuroimaging

Useful skills to have (otherwise will be trained):
- Working with imaging data
- Shell scripting
- High-performance and/or cloud computing (SLURM, OpenStack..)
- Git
- Docker/Singularity
- Continuous integration

Job Title: Software Development for Brain Cancer Therapy

In collaboration with a neurosurgeon, a neuroscientist and an engineer, the Wong lab is creating a treatment planning system integrating:

Its media app 'theScore' is one of the most popular in North America, delivering fans highly personalized live scores, news, stats, and betting information from their favorite teams, leagues, and players. theScore's mobile sports betting app 'theScore Bet' delivers an immersive and holistic mobile sports betting experience. Natively built for iOS and Android devices, theScore Bet is deeply integrated with theScore's media app and is currently available to residents of New Jersey. Publicly traded on the TSX Venture Exchange (SCR), theScore also creates and distributes innovative digital content through its web, social and esports platforms.

As part of the theScore team, you will be working with a team of smart, friendly, and dedicated Engineers, Product Managers and Designers determined to deliver some of the best apps the market has to offer. We want you to be challenged and to get the full experience of what it's like to work at theScore!
Job Responsibilities:
Working with our preferred technology stack (Primarily Elixir/Phoenix, Ruby on Rails, modern JavaScript).
Develop, scale, and optimize amazing GraphQL & RESTful APIs.
Be part of our backend service teams supporting web and mobile clients.
Build front-end applications using modern JavaScript technologies (React, TypeScript).
Participate in the design, architecture, and delivery of new features in a collaborative agile/scrum environment.
Other duties as required.
Required Skills:
A solid foundation in computer science, with strong competencies in data structures, distributed systems, algorithms and software design.
Passionate about clean code architecture and software craftsmanship.
Experience with modern web framework and API development (Elixir/Phoenix, Ruby on Rails, Sinatra, Django, Node).
Experience with Git and GitHub or similar.
A strong grasp and experience with relational databases; including PostgreSQL, MySQL & CockroachDB.
Experience with background job processing (Exq, Sidekiq, Celery, Beanstalk, RabbitMQ).
Comfortable working in the terminal.
Proficiency within an editor of your choice.
Experience with testing frameworks such as ExUnit, RSpec, Jest, pytest or equivalent.
Experience working with profiling tools.
Knowledge and familiarity with caching strategies and tools.
Consuming and integrating with third party APIs.
NICE TO HAVE: Familiarity with GraphQL APIs (Absinthe), GraphQL schema stitching & subscriptions, GCP, Kubernetes, JavaScript SSR, contribution to open source software, experience working at startups, passion for sports and/or esports.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Applied Mathematics
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science
				
			
				MATH - Pure Mathematics
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
We are looking for a Co-op student to join our Back-End Development team. Preferably, someone with knowledge of Golang and Ruby, but knowledge of Python and Java is also desired. Our team is looking for a future Developer who wants to focus on building tools that change the way organisations think about data.

At ThinkData, we don't want to put you in a box before you get here. We are looking for people who are passionate about programming and who love learning and using new tools and languages. If you are a skilled developer, we will use your strengths to grow our platform, deepen your experience, and offer the best data management services available.

What's in it for you?
The chance to make an impact. You will be empowered to make decisions and make a difference as a member of the team. Students are as part of the team as any other Full-Time employee. 
Access to new tech. At ThinkData we don't shy away from bleeding edge tech. We encourage you to experiment, test and push the boundaries through research and development.
New builds. You will utilize open source tech to help build new, unique product features, addressing change requests and incorporating user feedback into the product roadmap.
A clean slate. We have new ideas to develop and we are open to new concepts. This is a chance to help develop products and APIs on a virtual blank page and introduce your own ideas for future products.
A dynamic environment. We are a startup that works with enterprise companies. That means complex challenges that are continuously changing. It's projects that quickly evolve as we respond to the demands of the environment and innovate to solve problems that might not even exist yet.

About Us
ThinkData Works, Inc. is a Toronto-based technology startup whose data management platform, Namara, is used by some of the foremost organizations in the world to process and refine data into usable products. We host one of the largest repositories of publicly available data and enable our clients to significantly increase the amount of information they use to fuel solutions.
At ThinkData, our mission is to build the easiest and most secure solution that enables our users to access, integrate, and collaborate on the data that powers their business. Some of the largest companies in the world, from tech to banking and beyond, use our platform. 

We're not a single-solution AI company or a consulting firm disguised as a startup. We're interested in solving the fundamental problem of accessing and distributing data. Namara as a data management platform will propel the next wave of intelligent solutions.

Need more reasons to join?
We may be technologically driven, but like every Canadian, we know the best ideas are thought of up north in a cottage. During the summer, we take the whole team on a 3-day retreat for vision-setting, aligning our goals, product management, and team-building. We're not saying this involves guitars, and songs by the campfire. But we're not saying it doesn't.
We are managing our growth. We continue to promote and nurture the open, collaborative nature of who we are and how we work. We work hard while still having fun, being ourselves, hanging out together, and enjoying delicious snacks at the office. 
And we don't just support each other in the office. The number of musicians in-house is pretty overwhelming, from 90s cover bands to death metal. There's always a co-worker with a gig coming up and we love to go out and cheer them on.

One final note before applying
ThinkData Works prides itself for its diversity and being an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.
We value all of our applicants, but due to the high volume of applications we receive, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
Candidates must be legally eligible to work in Canada.

COVID 19 Update:
Due to COVID-19, the ThinkData Works team is currently working remotely. All interviews will be conducted over video call. Until a broad solution to COVID-19 emerges, expect that your position here will be remote as well.
Job Responsibilities:
As part of the Ingest team, you will support in building tools for loading, cleansing, and exporting data sets from a variety of sources and formats. You will work along side the team in the current project, called JABBA, which is the next generation of ETL. 
- General maintenance of the Ingest pipeline, including features and bug fixes.
- Develop integration with the Namara Platform
- Ingesting problematic datasets for client deliveries
- Integrating normalization reporting into Namara
- Job level operations, such as stopping, resuming, estimating, etc.
- Optimizing pipeline performance.
Required Skills:
Push us to the next level. You have the desire to gain exposure to data analytics products, you bring knowledge of Golang and Ruby, or Java and Ruby. You can work on our back-end, pick up new tech easily and build out tools. Familiarity with Docker, RabbitMQ, Postgres, Redis, Angular, and/or React is an asset.
Prove yourself. You are working towards a degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related degree. 
Innovate solutions to complex problems. Communication and decisiveness are key as is the ability to weigh the opinions of others. You can confidently make software design decisions.
Collaborate. You will be mentored by the team, work autonomously and as a contributing team member.
Evolve with us. The landscape is being built under our feet as we move forward, so we need people who can channel their passion, learn quickly and navigate the unknown at top speed.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:

The student will work closely with a team of data scientists and developers to build a core platform solution using ML and NLP for practical business needs (e.g. entity resolution). This role will involve hands-on building & scaling our product as well as contributions to the product roadmap.  Our ideal candidate enjoys solving challenging problems the most efficient way possible, and wants to be part of a team that propels the next wave of data science, machine learning, and artificial intelligence.
 
What's in it for you?
The chance to make an impact. You will be empowered to make decisions and make a difference as a member of the Data Labs team. Students are as part of the team as any other Full-Time employee.
Access to new tech. At ThinkData we don't shy away from bleeding edge tech. We encourage you to experiment, test and push the boundaries through research and development.
New builds. You will utilize, contribute to, and build upon open source tech, you will build a new, unique product, adding features, addressing change requests and incorporating user feedback into the product roadmap.
A clean slate. We have new ideas to develop and we are open to new concepts. This is a chance to develop products and APIs on a virtual blank page and introduce your own ideas for future products.

We host one of the largest repositories of publicly available data and enable our clients to significantly increase the amount of information they use to fuel solutions.
 
At ThinkData, our mission is to build the easiest and most secure solution that enables our users to access, integrate, and collaborate on the data that powers their business. Some of the largest companies in the world, from tech to banking and beyond, use our platform.
 
We're not a single-solution AI company or a consulting firm disguised as a startup. We're interested in solving the fundamental problem of accessing and distributing data. Namara as a data management platform will propel the next wave of intelligent solutions.
 
Need more reasons to join?
We may be technologically driven, but like every Canadian, we know the best ideas are thought of up north in a cottage. We are managing our growth. We continue to promote and nurture the open, collaborative nature of who we are and how we work. And we don't just support each other in the office. The number of musicians in-house is pretty overwhelming, from 90s cover bands to death metal. There's always a co-worker with a gig coming up and we love to go out and cheer them on.
 
We work hard while still knowing how to have fun and being ourselves, hanging out together outside of work and enjoying delicious snacks at the office.
 
One final note before applying
 ThinkData Works prides itself for its diversity and being an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.
 
We value all of our applicants, but due to the high volume of applications we receive, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

As part of the Data Labs team, you will work closely with a team of Data Scientists and Developers to build a core platform solution using ML and NLP for practical business needs (e.g. Entity Resolution). This role will involve hands-on building and scaling our products, as well as contributing to the product roadmap.

- Build software and provide services that solve the most common data science and NLP problems for us and our clients.
- Work with a variety of structured and unstructured data sources. 
- Implement creative data acquisition and labelling systems for solving NLP problems.

Prove yourself: Strong software engineering skills in Python and knowledge of Machine Learning is required. Knowledge and experience using NLP is an asset. 
Innovate solutions to complex problems. Communication and decisiveness are key as is the ability to weigh the opinions of others. You can confidently make software design decisions.
Collaborate. You can mentor the team, work autonomously and as a contributing team member.
Evolve with us. The landscape is being built under our feet as we move forward, so we need people who can channel their passion, learn quickly and navigate the unknown at top speed.

Job Summary:
Third Sector Publishing is the creator of CharityCAN, a SaaS platform that helps Canadian charities find, qualify and connect with major donors.

We want the organizations improving the world we live in to get the funding necessary to continue their work. We help them by bringing data from across the internet together into major donor profiles, connecting charities to funders in the process.

As a full stack web developer, you'll help us with that mission by designing, building and maintaining new features for CharityCAN.

You'll be a member of our small, agile team, making real contributions to our platform.

This will be a remote co-op position for the Spring 2021 term. You will be asked to work from a home office or other remote location. Computer equipment can be provided to students local to Waterloo Region.
Job Responsibilities:
As a full stack web developer, you'll be writing code across our entire web application to:
- Import and update the data in our database
- Connect CharityCAN to other 3rd party data sources
- Retrieve data from our database and serve it to the front end via a RESTful API
- Create new frontend UI and UX to present the data to our users in a useful way

Our web application has a React JS frontend powered by a .NET web API (and some legacy VB code) and a SQL database + Neo4j graph database backend. We sprinkle in other web technologies where applicable too (redis, node.js, npm).

Our backend data processing suite is written in python.
Required Skills:
We're looking for someone who can get started relatively quickly. To that end, we're hoping you have experience with:
- Creating modern web applications (or some part of one)
- At least one of the following technologies from a previous work term: Javascript, C#, SQL, python
- Source control (e.g. Git)

Bonus points for experience with/interest in:
- React JS
- The .NET web stack
- Cloud infrastructure (Azure)
- Graphing databases (Neo4j)
- Database ORMs
- MVC web frameworks
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
Job Description - Thompson Flow Investigations Inc (TQI)

Thompson Flow Investigations Inc. (TQI) is a leader in the field of I/I (Inflow/ Infiltration) studies. TQI is currently working on projects in the Cities of Toronto, the GTA.

In these studies we basically act as "sewer detectives" trying to quantify and locate undesired / prohibited connections to the sanitary and storm sewer systems. Undesirable connections can lead to basement flooding, by-passing of raw sewage to rivers / lakes and impaired treatment plant efficiency.

TQI conducts sewer smoke testing, dye testing and flow monitoring in various sewer systems. Flow monitoring is a vital tool in our work and is essentially "applied" open channel hydraulics.
Job Responsibilities:
During this work term there will be a focus on conducting smoke testing and dye testing to help locate undesired / prohibited connections of surface drainage to the sewers. Exposure to the operation of flow monitoring networks and data reduction is also likely. In this position you will learn and carry out confined space entry (manhole entry) and interact with the public.

You will have an opportunity to observe varied open channel hydraulic flow conditions in real sewers. If you are interested in a career in municipal engineering or open channel hydraulics, the experience gained in this position will prove valuable throughout your career. You may also be involved in some technical report writing and be exposed to the "workings" of a small specialized firm
Required Skills:
Capabilities / interests that will be an asset (not a pre-requisite) in this job include:

Outdoor Experience
Mechanical aptitude
A valid Driver's Licence
Access to an automobile preferred
Experience with power tools and/or wood working tools
An interest in a mix of field and office work
Good computer skills
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Waste or Wastewater Management 
				
			
				ENG - Civil, Environmental and Geological Engineering
				
			
				ENV - Geography and Environmental Management
				
			
				SCI - Earth, Environmental and Geological Sciences
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Cover Letter,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
About Us
Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we have been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world's most global news services - Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing. 

We are powered by the talents of 25,000 employees across more than 75 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in a flexible work environment that celebrates diversity and inclusion. In today's time, where objectivity, accuracy, fairness and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. 

What's in it for you?
Grow your career in software development by working on our market-leading technology solutions. Apply your skills and passion for technology to work with a team driving innovation throughout the entire software lifecycle, from defining specifications and architecting designs to writing efficient and maintainable code. Here's your chance to participate in enhancements of Thomson Reuters software utilized by professionals across the globe, while developing your expertise along the way. 
Want to hear from our engineers on how it is like #WorkingatTR? Check out- Video 1, Video 2

Where are we located? 
Our Technology Centre location is a short walk away from Union Station in downtown Toronto. The fresh new office space features a game room, open collaboration spaces, amazing views of the waterfront and the CN Tower, healthy snacks in our kitchen, and regularly scheduled fun team events. 
But due to the given pandemic, we are working remotely till July 2021, which will be further reviewed based on the situation. 

Awards
Thomson Reuters has been recognized by 
- WayUp Top 100 Internship Programs 2020
- The Career Directory, as Canada's Best Employer for Recent Graduates
- 2021 Campus Forward Honoree
- Fairygodboss as Best Companies for Women
- Greater Toronto's Top 2020 Employers
- FORTUNE as a World's Most Admired Company 
- Globe and Mail as a Top 100 Employers in Canada for nine consecutive years
Job Responsibilities:
As a member of Thomson Reuters' ONESOURCE Platform Technology team, you will work with your team members to help extend our market-leading platform of corporate tax software solutions and services for global businesses. You will build and influence new technologies, processes, and methodologies.
Within our agile team, you will be responsible for creating high-quality solutions as part of the development of new features and enhancing the infrastructure of the ONESOURCE Platform. You will be involved in the entire software development lifecycle, working collaboratively with the team including other developers and product owners, and must have a desire for creating sustainable and efficient solutions. Your work will benefit customers who use the numerous critical tax products provided by Thomson Reuters.

You will gain: 

Experience in a collaborative, agile work environment delivering consumer product
The tools you need to be successful, in a relaxed work environment
Sharpened technical skills with the opportunity to grow a career, not just a job
Required Skills:
Qualifications:

You have a passion for technology
You are self-motivated with the ability to work effectively on a team
You also have excellent analytical and problem-solving skills

Your specific experience includes: 

Solid academic record
Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively in a team environment
Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Having experience in one of the following areas:

C++, C#, or Java 
Web application development, Web services, Mobile development or Cloud services (AWS, Azure)
Good understanding of object-oriented design, data structures and algorithms
Development and troubleshooting of customer-facing software applications
Software testing, performance tuning within large and complex software systems
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Systems Design and Biomedical Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science
				
			
				MATH - Computing and Financial Management
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report

We are powered by the talents of 25,000 employees across more than 75 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in a flexible work environment that celebrates diversity and inclusion. In today's time, where objectivity, accuracy, fairness and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. 

What's in it for you?
Grow your career in software development by working on our market-leading technology solutions. Apply your skills and passion for technology to work with a team driving innovation throughout the entire software lifecycle, from defining specifications and architecting designs to writing efficient and maintainable code. Here's your chance to participate in enhancements of Thomson Reuters software utilized by professionals across the globe, while developing your expertise along the way. 
Want to hear from our engineers on how it is like #WorkingatTR? Check out- Video 1, Video 2

Where are we located? 
Our Technology Centre location is a short walk away from Union Station in downtown Toronto. The fresh new office space features a game room, open collaboration spaces, amazing views of the waterfront and the CN Tower, healthy snacks in our kitchen, and regularly scheduled fun team events. 
But due to the given pandemic, we are working remotely till July 2021, which will be further reviewed based on the situation. 

Awards

- WayUp Top 100 Internship Programs 2020

- Fairygodboss as Best Companies for Women
- Greater Toronto's Top 2020 Employers
- FORTUNE as a World's Most Admired Company 
- Globe and Mail as a Top 100 Employers in Canada for nine consecutive years

About ThoughtWire
=================
ThoughtWire's smart building and smart hospital software solutions empower it's clients in commercial real estate and healthcare to optimize building operations and improve occupant experience by orchestrating data from people, processes, and the connected building in a smart digital asset - the Built Environment Digital Twin. 

ThoughtWire's innovative applications that are deployed in the cloud and on-premise, are all powered by ThoughtWire's Built Environment Digital Twin, which breaks down silos of data to deliver the right information to the right people in context so they can take action. Whether it's creating a seamless experience for officer workers inside a building or streamlining clinical operations, ThoughtWire is determined to make built environments healthier, safer, and more efficient places to live, work and play.

We are a friendly team made up of people with diverse backgrounds, different levels of experience and a wide spectrum of knowledge and skills. We are committed to agile processes, touch many cutting edge technologies, and use a wide array of open source software.

ThoughtWire is located in the eclectic St. Lawrence neighbourhood in downtown Toronto, close to Union station, the subway and streetcar routes. Enjoy great restaurants, interesting parks, fabulous street life and a close knit team.

Job Summary:
Are you interested in learning how to market cutting-edge software applications to healthcare, facility management,and IT  professionals and c-suites? Would you describe yourself as a wordsmith? Design wizard? Social media maven? Are you curious about technology, startups, and high-tech marketing? Well, ThoughtWire's Marketing Internship may be right for you.
Step into our world where only three things really matter: our customers, our message, and our channels. As our superstar marketing intern you'll get exposure to the entire marketing value chain, from strategy, to messaging, to content writing, social media strategy, events and all things digital. 

We're a small collaborative team; you'll report to the Digital Marketing Manager and help drive multiple projects. This isn't a get-us-coffee-and-organize-our-files kind of internship. We want to help you learn by doing. This role is ideal for someone who wants first-hand experience in what it feels like to be a part of a fast-growing startup. 


We're a small collaborative team, you'll report to the Digital Marketing Manager and help drive multiple projects. This isn't a get us coffee and organize our files kind of an internship. We want to help you learn by doing. This role is ideal for someone who wants first-hand experience in what it feels like to be a part of a fast-growing startup.
Job Responsibilities:
What you'll get to do:

Content Writing and Marketing Operations: Help us write compelling blog content for our thought leaders, publish this content on HubSpot with great images and copy to help convert readers to followers and eventually customers.

Design: Use various design programs (Adobe specifically) to create impactful content to share on social and help with the design of various gated assets. 

Social Listening: Keep an ear to the ground for any ThoughtWire news that needs to be re-posted to our site, what our competitors are talking about, and our share of voice in the markets we serve.

Market Research: Help us stay on top with all the latest advances from the building tech world, as well as compiling competitive analysis reports.

Special Projects: Get in on exciting projects alongside our brilliant software engineering team, or with our designer, or in media relations, or any other initiative that may come our way from time to time.
Required Skills:
Finally, this is your internship ? if you're interested in SEO, advertising, working with sponsored content, or marketing automation/operations in tools like HubSpot ? there is endless opportunity to get involved and help make TW's marketing team stronger. 

We're looking for someone in their penultimate or final year of study in:
BCom or BBA 
Marketing, communications, journalism, or related field
What would make you stand out (but not essential):
Experience with email marketing
Experience in video editing
Experience using HubSpot

Job Summary:
Founded by engineers Ignacio Tartavull and Gellert Mattyus at the Design Fabrication Zone, Tiny Mile seeks to radically change up the way restaurants deliver food by replacing human drivers in cars with human operators behind a screen.

Geoffrey the A.I. delivery bot,  is named after computer scientist Geoffrey "the godfather of machine learning" Hinton.  Robot Geoffrey has been turning heads in downtown Toronto over the past few months simply by traversing city sidewalks

The goal is to eventually swap many cars for many little robots that can deliver food within a one-mile range in just 15 minutes by travelling at speeds of up to 6 km/h.  Not only would such a system reduce C02 emissions, it would allow people who normally couldn't afford restaurant delivery to access pre-made food and spend their time in other ways.

Tiny Mile is looking for help in developing the PCBs and electronics inside Geoffrey (our robot).

read more about the company:
(https://www.blogto.com/tech/2020/09/delivery-robot-geoffrey-toronto/)
Job Responsibilities: The robot is a 4 wheel robot, you will be adding more functionalities such as  speakers, microphones, sensors and cameras to it.  You will take charge in integrating all these gadgets to Geoffrey through your own research, design and hands on,  with guidance from the senior engineers.  At a start-up, the sky is the limit.
Required Skills:
PCB desgin and prototyping.
Research skills
Persistence
Open to trying new directions

Job Summary:
Titanium Agency is a performance marketing agency located in the heart of Uptown Waterloo. We're a small, but mighty team of talented individuals who love to solve challenges through teamwork and collaboration. We keep the bureaucracy to a minimum and believe in putting the right people in roles where they'll thrive. That's why we're big on autonomy, ongoing learning, asking the tough questions, and taking calculated risks.

Students at Titanium are offered all the opportunities our full-time staff enjoy.  If you are intelligent, hard working and ambitious, the sky is the limit for you here.  Everyone here is given as much responsibility as they can manage.

As a Software Engineer at Titanium you will be helping us build tools to automate and optimize our operations.  Our platform is build on Google BigQuery, Cloud SQL and App Engine.  Our front ends are built with ASP.net.  In order to automate our operations not only will you help us develop algorithms that will make operational decisions, but you will learn how to utilize API's from marketing partners such as Facebook and Google in order to execute these decisions.

You will be fully integrated with the team and will be the primary developer on these projects.
Job Responsibilities:
Engaged in all aspects of the software development lifecycle
Quickly build applications in an Agile environment
Assist in the development, testing, and maintenance of internal applications
Analyze and troubleshoot program code and correct errors as required
Provide software documentation both in program code and externally
Required Skills:
Minimum 2+ years software development experience
Experience with or an ability to learn ASP.net and C#
Basic SQL would be a nice to have but if not we can teach you 
Preference given to anyone with existing GCP experience
Highly analytical, and good managing large amounts of data

Job Summary:
* This is a remote position* 

Tjene ((v.) [tuh-jean] meaning "to serve" in Norwegian) practices consulting and advisory services in Canada, U.S., and Europe. Tjene specializes in Corporate Real Estate, Integrated Workplace Management Systems, Business Intelligence, and Data Management. Headquarters are located in Toronto, Ontario and Dallas, Texas. 
 
Tjene Life
 
- Cohesive: Tjene's industry purpose is to serve our clients with world class solutions and methodologies. With offices in Toronto and Dallas, we are a uniquely cohesive unit in an industry where reliance on remote workers are the status quo.
- Cross Functional: All employees are cross-trained to serve in a functional and technical capacity.
- Quick Turnaround Time: Our highly collaborative environment has allowed us to build a robust knowledge base and provide quick turnaround times on deliverables.
- Technology Approach: Tjene's culture fosters a progressive approach to new technologies, setting the pace in the industry. This has resulted in creative technology solutions and proprietary technologies developed in-house. 
- Process Approach: Tjene takes a process-oriented approach to problem solving. From offering best practices to process re-engineering, Tjene understands the importance of robust and efficient business processes.
Job Responsibilities:
A Front-End Developer Intern is responsible for Custom Software Development and Integrations.
 
Responsibilities

Project Delivery and Management: Prioritize and deliver assigned work on time.
Collaboration & Innovation: Collaborate with team members to develop innovative and adaptable solutions in order to meet changing client business needs and create repeatable standards that can be leveraged across the organization.
Software Configuration and Development: Review current systems and present ideas for system improvements, while working closely with Project Teams to produce detailed specifications.
Quality Assurance: Test products in controlled and real situations before going into production; maintain these systems once they are up and running.

Position overview
This is a great opportunity for a motivated individual interested in obtaining exposure to the occupational health and safety field in transit and construction industry.   This position participates in Health, Safety, Security, Environment and Emergency program management and improvement initiatives including safety performance data processing and trend analysis.  The position works closely with staff of ECE Safety and Security, project and construction management teams, contractors, internal transit and maintenance operations, and other Departments.    In this role, the successful candidate will gain knowledge of transit operations, construction projects and health, safety, security, environment and emergency programs.
Job Responsibilities:
Job Details
-The positon supports ECE Health and Safety Analyst with the following:
 

Data capturing and organization,
Analysis of data,
Preparation of safety performance and other reports and,
Printing, copying, binding, and filing of various documents

 
-Other tasks involve providing assistance to Construction Safety Officers with:
 

Field Site Safety Observations,
Attendance of safety and construction meetings,
Review of contractor safety plans,
Development of safety training presentations,
Workplace Inspections,
Participation in incident investigations
Required Skills:
Skills/Knowledge/Qualifications:

Advanced computer skills (MS Excel, Word, PowerPoint)
Ability to establish working relationships with various workplace parties
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Detail oriented
Experience in data trend analysis

Education

2nd or 3rd year University students in the field of Business/IT Management with focus on data management and analytics, Civil / Industrial Engineering, Occupational Health and Safety or Construction / Project Management

Experience

Exposure to data management in the transit and construction industry is desirable
Familiarity with transit and construction environment is an asset

 Physical Demands/Working Conditions

The position is based in an office setting.
Visits to TTC operational / construction field offices, construction sites in rail yards, subway tunnel, subway stations, subway / streetcar carhouses, shops and bus garages. 
Site visits may require considerable walking. 

 
Other

The position reports to ECE Manager ? Safety & Security who is a licenced Professional Engineer (P.Eng.) and Canadian Registered Safety Professional (CRSP)
The work experience may qualify for the requirements associated with obtaining P.Eng. licence and/or CRSP designation
Salaries range from $22.11 - $26.50 per hour within a 35-hour work week.
Personal Protective Equipment will be provided

 
This Student Position resides in North York, ON and is a 4 or 8 (co-op) month work term commencing May, 2020.  It is mandatory that all applicants are enrolled in full-time studies at a post-secondary institution and returning to full-time studies upon completion of the work term
