Job Summary:
Employer:   Toronto Transit Commission, Information Technology Services
Job Title:     Software Developer Co-op Student
Work Location:   Toronto
 



Job Description:
 
The Information Technology Services (ITS) Department has an opportunity for a student with excellent programming ability and a desire to expand his/her application development, systems design and interpersonal skills. You will maintain and develop web and client server applications in a .NET Windows environment using C#, JavaScript, SQL/Oracle, VBA, Crystal Reports and Microsoft Office.
Job Responsibilities:
Your responsibilities will include:
- Coding program instructions in one or more of the following .NET C#, JavaScript, Crystal Reports (BOE - Enterprise Reporting), Visual Basic for Applications (VBA), in a web or client server environment.
- Supporting C# .NET web applications and Microsoft Access/Excel VBA Applications using Windows 10 and MS Office.
- Writing, debugging and testing coded programs.
- Establishing program requirements through the analysis of various technical systems and databases.
- Providing application documentation to the Development group. This may include documenting business requirements, functional specifications and other related project documentation.
- Providing application training & operating instructions to the User groups.
- Adhering to the TTC's Software Development Life Cycle and application development policies and standards
Required Skills:
Skills Required:
- Experience or knowledge of .NET development using C#, ASP .NET, WCF, JavaScript, Ajax Control Toolkit, HTML, Crystal Reports, VBA, Windows 10.
- Knowledge of how to implement applications in a web and client server environment.
- Experience using Visual Basic for Applications within MS Access & Excel is an asset.
- Developed communication, interpersonal, problem-solving, analytical and conceptual skills.

Tools that you will be using include .NET C#, Visual Studio 2012, Team Foundation Server (TFS), SQL Server, Oracle, Excel, Access, Visual Basic for Applications, Crystal Reports, Windows 10 and Microsoft Office. Some reference materials are available for self-training in Access, Crystal Reports and Oracle.

This position allows considerable self-direction and is best suited for students who work well both on their own and with other people. It also offers exposure to a variety of business related activities dealing with the end-users.

You will be working under the supervision of the Senior Systems Analyst.

Transportation will be provided via a TTC pass

Toyota Canada Inc. (TCI) is the exclusive Canadian distributor of Toyota and Lexus vehicles. Toyota Canada's head office is in Toronto, with regional offices in Vancouver, Calgary, Montreal and Halifax. Toyota parts and accessories are distributed through TCI's Parts Distribution Centers in Toronto and Vancouver. TCI supports over 280 Toyota and Lexus dealerships in Canada with services that include training, sales, marketing, environmental and customer satisfaction initiatives.
                                                               
What Sets Us Apart?
A focus on People, Passion for Toyota, Innovation and Make Things Better has made us an award-winning company, recognized worldwide for our technological leadership and superior standards of quality, community involvement and environmental responsibility.
 
Toyota currently has an exciting co-op opportunity at our Scarborough Head office for a Toyota National Sales Co-op starting Summer 2021. During your placement, you will work in a dynamic environment with an enthusiastic and engaged team who has a passion in sales and marketing.
Job Responsibilities:
What you'll be doing:
As a member of our team, you would have the opportunity to:

Develop a strong understanding of Toyota National sales operations, focusing on both retail and fleet sales
Support with the review and processing of Dealership advertising co-op claims
Support the fleet team with building customer tenders and presentations
Analyze and report on key Toyota sales performance indicators, including monthly Dealership sales results
Analyze and report on competitive sales performance
Conduct special project research related to automotive industry and make

recommendations to management


Assist in preparing presentations and meeting summaries
Coordinate activities between TCI and Regional Zone Offices
Conduct other tasks and activities as requested in support of Toyota National Sales
Gain knowledge on Toyota's business practices and efficient problem-solving
Anything else you want to get involved in!
Required Skills:
What you Bring:

Currently enrolled in a college/university business co-op program
Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Office applications (Excel, Word, PowerPoint)
Excellent organizational and interpersonal skills
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
Strong communication skills
Ability to work both independently and collaboratively
Knowledge of automotive industry and dealership operations is an asset

What You Should Know:  
Our success begins and ends with our people. We embrace diverse perspectives and value unique human experiences. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer that celebrates the diversity of the communities where we live and do business. Applicants for our positions are considered without regard to race, ethnicity, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, religion, or any other characteristics protected by law.

Job Title:
NEW
									



										Production Control Co-op Analyst - Packaging and Logistics
Job Summary:
ABOUT US: 
Toyota Motor Manufacturing Canada Inc. (TMMC) is a world-class automotive assembly organization which produces the top-quality Toyota RAV4 and the Lexus RX 350 and RX 450h, at our Cambridge and Woodstock facilities.  Our Administrative departments provide a diverse number of Co-op positions, in areas such as Finance, Human Resources, Corporate Planning, Information Systems and Production Control. Our Engineering departments support all areas of Manufacturing (Paint, Plastics, Assembly, Stamping and Weld,), also including Facilities/Building Services, Environmental and Quality Control.  If you are interested in engaging in challenging projects with high levels of responsibility, then TMMC may be for you.  You will be trained in our Toyota Business Practice methodology, which is a unique method of problem solving that supports our commitment to continuous improvement at TMMC. 

To learn more about TMMC please visit our website:  www.tmmc.ca - careers, you will learn why we have obtained numerous awards.
 
TMMC is an equal opportunity employer committed to building a diverse workforce. We believe in enabling people of different ages, sexes, sexual orientations, gender identities, gender expressions, colours, races, ancestries, citizenships, ethnic origins, places of origin, and creeds to work together and realize their full potential. TMMC is committed to compliance with all applicable legislation including providing accommodation for applicants with disabilities. Please advise us at any point during the recruitment and selection process if you require accommodation.

LOCATION:  Primarily working in the TMMC, Cambridge facility with the possibility of occasional visits to the TMMC, Woodstock facility depending on the business need.
Job Responsibilities:
Department Description: 
The Logistics group manages the flow of parts and components through the supply chain from the supplier's shipping dock to the plant's receiving dock. The Logistics group manages North American parts flow and Overseas parts flow. North American logistics control includes management of over-the-road, cross-dock, and yard/trailer management logistics partners, systems and processes. In addition to this, the North American logistics control involves the planning and design of the logistics network to determine the best freight routing methods. Overseas logistics control manages container shipments from the ports in Japan to the west coast of Canada/USA, from there on to rail and from the rail depots in Toronto to the plants via trucking.
 
Co-Op Role - Spring 2021 will be from Monday, May 3, 2021 to Friday, August 20, 2021. 
 
Co-Op Student Role:
The successful candidate will have a mentor to lead them in their training and have them levelled up to support daily functions/projects within the logistics group.
 
Co-Op Student Project:
The project will be cost efficiency focused to determine opportunities within our North American logistics network for routing change/freight planning improvements.

Root cause analysis of current conditions to drive problem identification
Statistical analysis of routing and freight volume information
Proposal generation with simple explanation/proof for management buy-in/consensus
Required Skills:
Job Skill Requirements:

The ability to visualize operational status, Logistics Partner KPIs, and project progress as required
Flexibility to support both Cambridge and Woodstock operations onsite if necessary
Advanced computer skills to perform quantitative calculations, and produce the desired outputs
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Business Administration
				
			
				- Theme - Data Analytics, Statistical Analysis and Mathematical Optimization 
				
			
				- Theme - Manufacturing and Process Engineering
				
			
				- Theme - Supply Chain Management and Logistics 
				
			
				ENG - Management Sciences
				
			
				MATH - Applied Mathematics
				
			
				SCI - Business

Materials Management - Production Control
Materials Management is responsible for managing materials/parts required for building vehicles for North America and Overseas. The team manages over 4000 parts per vehicle and ensures that they all arrive to TMMC JIT. Working with the Manufacturing team, the group also supports overages and shortages as well as manages abnormal events related to parts supply.

Location:  Primarily TMMC, Cambridge with possible visits to TMMC, Woodstock depending on the business needs. 

Co-Op Role - Spring 2021 will be from Monday, May 3, 2021 to Friday, August 20, 2021. 
 
Co-op Role:
The Co-op Student will have a Lead Specialist who will train in the core job, to level up the understanding of the group function and customer expectations. They will provide analysis into day to day operations and identify tools to improve roles. Examples of tools that have been created are KPI reporting tools using PowerBI; automated risk reporting tools using Excel; and web displays for critical expedites. The student will also have the opportunity to learn the JIT process and leverage newer business tools to innovate where possible.
 
Co-Op Term Project Focus Items:

Utilize new reporting technologies such as PowerBi to consolidate & visualize complex KPIs to Analysts & Sr. Management.
Identify key operational tools & systems which can also be leveraged on mobile devices using Office 365 to reduce Analyst burden/process.
Upon creation & execution of these tools see ensure once fully deployed it is well documented to ensure overall sustainment.
Understand key Production Control Materials KPI's which will drive action to support multiple stakeholders.

Job Summary:
ABOUT US:  
Toyota Motor Manufacturing Canada Inc. (TMMC) is a world-class automotive assembly organization which produces the top-quality Toyota RAV4 and the Lexus RX 350 and RX 450h, at our Cambridge and Woodstock facilities.  Our Administrative departments provide a diverse number of Co-op positions, in areas such as Finance, Human Resources, Corporate Planning, Information Systems and Production Control. Our Engineering departments support all areas of Manufacturing (Paint, Plastics, Assembly, Stamping and Weld,), also including Facilities/Building Services, Environmental and Quality Control.  If you are interested in engaging in challenging projects with high levels of responsibility, then TMMC may be for you.  You will be trained in our Toyota Business Practice methodology, which is a unique method of problem solving that supports our commitment to continuous improvement at TMMC.

Job Responsibilities:
Co-Op Role - Spring 2021 will be from Monday, May 3, 2021 to Friday, August 20, 2021. 

Product Quality Control Engineering  
Quality Control Engineering (Q.C.E) is the largest Engineering group within TMMC.  They are responsible for ensuring high levels of product quality by defining fit, function and performance standards as well as quality processes at TMMC and at our Suppliers.  The Q.C.E role also includes performing risk analysis on Engineering Changes that may affect vehicle quality and perform technical problem solving to develop solid engineering solutions to potential quality concerns. The group is responsible to ensure that vehicles meet all design expectations and satisfy customers.  They achieve this by working with Suppliers, TMMC Shops (Assembly, Weld, Paint, etc) and the completed vehicle. 

Co-op Role: 
The Co-op student will be a part of our Q.C.E. group and participate in daily meetings and activities. The student will work with a lead mentor on various vehicle quality concerns. They will be exposed to Toyota's problem-solving methods and have the opportunity to experience hands on problem solving on the production floor.
 
Term Project Focus: 
Q.C.E. students will be given challenging problems to investigate and solve, some examples include:

Assembly fit issues: chronic installation struggles with assembly interior or exterior garnishes
Warranty investigations: study of high warranty issues and implementation of counter measures
Vehicle measurement studies: analyze body fit data to level up concern areas
Body CMM data trend setup, analysis and feedback system
PowerBI setup for regular management report
Support day to day urgent issues and concerns

Location: Cambridge and Woodstock.
Required Skills:
Job Skills: 
Self-starter with strong interpersonal skills and organizational ability. 
Strong multi-tasking abilities 
Ability to work in a multi-disciplined environment with minimal supervision. / MS Office and Outlook.

Job Summary: We are looking for amazing people who have a passion in coding and have a good head on their shoulders. We want web and app developers who are talented and smart people with a solid foundation of coding languages and problem solving.
Job Responsibilities:
TradeRev is an online automotive remarketing system where dealers can launch and participate in real-time vehicle auctions at any time from their mobile devices or desktop. It allows Sellers to obtain instant bids while the retail customer is sitting in the showroom by providing a private, customized network for Buyers and Sellers that quickly and efficiently move fresh trades.
 
We believe when it comes to buying a car, everyone should come out a winner. That's why we've created the world's first transparent automotive exchange, where every transaction plays out in the open for all to see and where both buyers and sellers are equally set up to win. Because we believe,  people should  trust the automotive purchase process, and get excited about it.

Why Work with Us?

Whether your Fun is in working with new technology, learning skills, collaborating with awesomely talented people or growing into a Specialist, Team Lead or People Manager, we want to feed this fire in you. If you have the work ethic, skill and motivation, we will help you find a path that leads you where your passion wants to go. So come on; let's have Fun together.

With Great Skills comes Great Responsibilities.  We understand that in order to attain and maintain amazing coding skills, it needs to be continually up to date, so we make sure you're all covered when it comes to any professional development, conferences, and licenses. It's on us. 

Take a look at our other benefits here: http://work.traderev.com/

Node/React/Javascript, Kotlin, Swift, Go, AWS, Kubernetes, Kafka, Istio/Service Mesh, etc.
 
You'll be at the heart of TradeRev's engineering team, building products and services that will bring transparency and trust to automotive sales process.

Job Summary:
This is an opportunity in the exciting and fast-growing transportation technology industry. Public transit is being transformed from a system of static, scheduled fixed-routes, to a dynamic on-demand network, and you'll be one of the pioneers shaping this transformation.

As Business Analyst, you'll be responsible for analyzing transportation operations data, performing service design, running simulations, assessing key performance indicators, supporting new service launches, driving operational improvements, and providing technical systems support. You will develop an understanding of urban mobility challenges faced by transit operators. You will become proficient with RideCo's technology platform and data-driven design and operation of transportation services. As a technical and analytics resource for operations managers, you'll have an important role in shaping the design, performance, and success of our clients' next-generation on-demand transportation services.

Who we are:
http://www.rideco.com
RideCo powers on-demand transit. Public transit agencies use RideCo's cloud-based software platform to provide on-demand shared rides in dynamically routed buses, vans, and cars. Our clients include some of the world's largest transportation operators such as Grab, San Antonio Metro, Los Angeles Metro, San Diego County, and Calgary Transit.

Have you experienced getting frustrated with transfers and waiting while taking a public bus? Have you seen buses drive around in low-density areas with very few passengers on-board and wondered how inefficient that seems to be? You're likely aware of the first & last mile access challenges faced by transit hubs. We are solving these problems by re-imagining shared mobility. Imagine a world where vehicles have dynamic routes responsive to real-time trip demand. This 'dynamic shuttle' (or van /sedan) would pick you up, on-demand, at or near your doorstep and take you to your destination or transit hub. Along the way, it may pick-up other passengers going in your direction. Your experience will be seamless: less waiting, less walking, fewer transfers, shorter travel time, and timely pickups and drop-offs. RideCo's 'dynamic shuttle' platform enables this seamless experience and low-cost shared rides for vehicle fleet operators and their passengers. By seamlessly moving more people in fewer vehicles we are catalyzing a generational shift in how people get around cities and towns. This means commuters spend less time in transit and more time doing what they enjoy.

RideCo powers a diverse range of use cases, including residential/ suburban travel; first-mile-last-mile connections for transit hubs; and corporate employee transportation. We are investing to scale up and capture the growing demand for on-demand shared rides solutions.
Job Responsibilities:
During your work term, your day-to-day responsibilities will include:

- Generate and analyze operational performance reports: Build comprehensive performance analysis reports spanning rider user-experience, driver user-experience, operating efficiency, and unit economics. Compare the performance against goals, evaluate trends, and identify areas for improvement.
- Run simulations and optimize service design: Perform simulations to analyze performance and operational KPIs. Iterate on the service model by tuning and optimizing dozens of parameters such as dynamic routing engine settings, vehicle count and mix, service frequency, location and density of potential stops, and demand models.
- Support new service launches: Support operations managers during the launch process, including monitoring KPIs on launch week and making system changes as needed.
- Provide systems support: Provide ongoing technical systems and analytics support to operations managers. Advise them on using the system's dashboards and interpreting the data. Perform system configuration changes based on feedback from operations staff, drivers, and passengers.
- Improve internal processes and tooling: Identify ways to further automate and systematize our internal processes, including with new analysis and visualization tools. Share your ideas with team members and collaboratively champion internal process/tooling improvements.
- Help build proposals for new projects and prospective clients.
Required Skills:
- Major in Math/Business/Economics 
- A cumulative average of greater than 70% 
- Proficient with Microsoft Excel and pivot tables 
- Comfortable with Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Access, PowerPoint and Word) 
- An innovative/entrepreneurial mindset
- Strong written/oral communication and presentation skills 
- Nice to have: Knowledge of relational databases with the ability to read and write SQL

Job Summary
The Internship Program provides qualified students with an excellent opportunity to gain first-hand experience, receive valuable on-the-job training and learn more about the property & casualty insurance industry.

Primary Job Duties & Responsibilities
This role is an exciting opportunity to work with one of the largest employers of P&C actuaries in North America. As an Actuarial Assistant, the successful candidate will be offered an opportunity to gain relevant property and casualty insurance and business experience in personal and/or commercial lines while working in a dynamic, team-focused environment.

As a member of the Actuarial Department, the candidate will act as an effective contributor to their team, and will interact with insurance professionals from underwriting, claims, finance and information systems as necessary.

There are four roles available -- one each for: 
Research and Development (R&D)
Business Insurance Pricing
Personal Insurance Pricing
Reserving

Candidates may be required to work for other teams on an ad-hoc basis however. The candidate will be responsible for a range of projects and tasks which will involve interaction with many areas of the business.

Each intern will be expected to complete challenging and meaningful project work over the course of this program. In addition, there are core assignments and a designated coach to further develop interns' insurance knowledge.

- Testing of new rate systems

- Participating in rate filing preparations

Job Summary:
The Behavioural Insights Unit within the Ontario Treasury Board Secretariat requires one (1) Research Analyst to join a team of professionals engaged in applying behavioural science research to solve some of the public sector's thorniest behaviour change challenges.

What you'll be doing
Ontario's Behavioural Insights Unit is part of the Centre of Excellence for Evidence-Based Decision Making, in the Treasury Board Secretariat. The Centre of Excellence for Evidence-Based Decision Making works with ministries to assess how programs are performing, using evidence to accelerate improvements to critical public services. Within the Centre, the Behavioural Insights Unit (BIU) explores the behavioural context of programs and services and offers low-cost ways to redesign programs for better outcomes.

Modeled after the United Kingdom's Behavioural Insights Team, the BIU operates as an internal consultancy and works across a variety of exciting policy domains. Our behavioural scientists and policy advisors work collaboratively with ministries and the broader public sector to apply the knowledge and methodologies of behavioural science ? from defining the problem, to testing and evaluating potential solutions.
As a research analyst, you will be directly involved in the design and prototyping of behaviourally informed solutions, as well as the quantitative and qualitative evaluations of these solutions in the field. On any given day, you may be supporting critical project meetings, participating in behavioural mapping workshops, helping to redesign a government form, letter or service in a solution brainstorm session, developing creative ways of pilot testing something in the field, or learning new data techniques to conduct exploratory or evaluative analysis.

Your impact 
In 2021, the BIU will continue to focus on supporting initiatives that use behavioural science insights in key policy areas, such as health, social services, and increasing the efficiency of government services. Overall, you will be helping to ensure that the Ontario Public Service relies on the best possible evidence, and maintains a relentless focus on the needs and perspectives of users. You will be a champion for innovative, people-centred approaches across government.
Examples of the Behavioural Insights Unit's completed projects include increasing the number of Ontarians who register to become organ donors, increasing the number of people who renew their vehicle license registration online, increasing the number of students who report their vaccines online to avoid suspension from school, and improving recycling behaviour. You can read more about our work in our 2018 and 2020 Update Reports on Ontario.ca.

Why join this team
We help make government work better for people by making it easier to access and participate in available programs and services. We provide a safe learning environment, with constructive feedback to help foster career growth and opportunities to collaborate with talented people. In addition, our team maintains strong links to academia (e.g., our work is featured in academic publications and conferences), and collaborates with teams at various levels across the public sector (federal, provincial, municipal, agencies).

Job details
The position is located in downtown Toronto, however this role will be completed remotely pending OPS policies on safe return to work.
All applicants should include a resume and academic transcript, as well as a cover letter indicating why you are interested in the position / why this is your dream job.
This position may be of interest to students in the academic disciplines of Psychology, Economics, Computer Science, Political Science, Public Policy/Public Administration, Business Administration, and others.
Required Skills:
What you bring to the team

Strong research, analysis and communication (written and oral) skills.
An eagerness to learn new things, and take new approaches to problem solving.
Skills in relationship development and collaborating with partners.
The ability to work out in the open as part of a team, but also to execute tasks thoroughly and independently.
A strong sense of initiative, and a drive to step up to support the team; no task is too big or small. 

 
Skills in design (e.g., Adobe CreativeSuite), and/or statistical software (e.g., SPSS, STATA), and/or programming (e.g., R) are an asset, but not required. Candidates should have experience with common office software (e.g., Excel, Powerpoint, Word).

Job Summary:
The Centre of Excellence (CoE) Unit within the Ontario Treasury Board Secretariat (TBS) is looking to hire one (1) Research Analyst to support its ongoing efforts to promote a culture of robust, evidence-based decision-making across government.

The CoE Unit aims to support ministries achieve better accountability, transparency and value-for-money by using evidence to inform their decisions, enabling them to select, fund and operate public programs more effectively and efficiently. It provides enterprise-wide expert advice, develops tools and guidance, and builds capacity to assess how programs are performing, using evidence to inform choices and lead change in public services. Specifically the team:

Leads the strategic planning and overall governance of complex, enterprise-wide transformation efforts.
Supports capacity-building across ministries, specific to developing performance measurement and evaluation frameworks, tracking performance, and driving continuous improvement.
Supports government planning processes in the assessment of program effectiveness, efficiency, modernization opportunities, and sustainability.
Deliver training on using evidence-based decision making to increase capacity, to assess how programs are performing, and support the modernization of government by focusing on outcomes, evaluation, sustainability, and continuous improvement.

The position is located at Queen's Park in downtown Toronto. Job to be completed remotely for the foreseeable future. This is subject to change pending OPS policies on a safe return to work.
Required Skills:
Applicants should have strong research, planning, coordination and communication (written and oral) as well as collaboration skills.
Candidates should also have experience with common office software including Microsoft Office 365.
An understanding or willingness to quickly acquire understanding of the government decision making process (e.g., the role of central agencies and Treasury Board/Management Board of Cabinet) and
Performance measurement and evaluation-related knowledge and/or experience would be an asset.

This position may be of interest to students in the academic disciplines of Economics, Public Policy/Public Administration, Finance, Political Science, Environment and Business, Business Administration, and others.

Job Summary:
The Strategic Alignment Office within the Ontario Treasury Board Secretariat (TBS) is looking to hire one (1) Research Analyst interested in learning more about the public service to join a team of professionals engaged in conducting complex strategic analysis and coordinating activities in a deadline driven environment. 

The Strategic Alignment Office is part of the Agenda Management and Strategic Alignment Branch within Office of the Treasury Board (OTB) in TBS, and is responsible for coordinating narrative into public-facing documents, such as Economic Outlook and Fiscal Review, the Ontario Budget, and Public Accounts.

The Strategic Alignment Office also provides leadership for staff development and employee engagement initiatives across OTB, supports OTB-wide human resources, business planning and corporate initiatives, and conducts research and analysis on interjurisdictional best practices. In addition, the Office provides coordination and direction across OTB for the Auditor General's Value - for - Money audits and follow-ups, as well as requests from the Financial Accountability Office and other Legislative Officers

The position is located at Queen's Park in downtown Toronto. Job to be completed remotely for the foreseeable future. This is subject to change pending OPS policies on a safe return to the workplace.

Student Testimonials

"My co-op experience at TBS allowed me to get involved in meaningful and rewarding public service work that directly impacts Ontarians. There is no better place than TBS to learn about how the government works!"

"As a co-op in the Office of the Treasury Board, I was given incredible opportunities to work alongside talented and driven professionals. Further, my position granted me ample opportunity to showcase my talent and engage in meaningful work at the highest levels of government."

"During my co-op term, I was given several opportunities to present my work to senior management."

"As a co-op student working for TBS, you are treated as a full team member and are given challenging tasks. I was tasked with conducting research, updating financial data, writing and editing briefing notes, and even presenting proposals to senior government executives.  Students in TBS are exposed to a broad range of policies and programs that Ontario is implementing, whether it be in health, transportation, education, Indigenous relations, or the environment. I was able to see which policy areas I'm interested in, and has propelled me to seek future co-op opportunities within these areas."
Required Skills:
Applicants should have strong research, planning, coordination and communication (written and oral) as well as collaboration skills.
Candidates should also have experience with common office software including Microsoft Office 365.
An understanding or willingness to quickly acquire understanding of the government decision making process (e.g., the role of central agencies and Treasury Board/Management Board of Cabinet) and
Project management knowledge and/or experience would be an asset.

This position may be of interest to students in the academic disciplines of Economics, Public Policy/Public Administration, Finance, Political Science, Environment and Business, Business Administration, and others.

Job Summary:
The Capital Expenditure Management Division within the Ontario Treasury Board Secretariat is looking for one (1) Research Analyst interested in learning more about the public service to join a team of professionals engaged in providing evidence-based analysis and recommendations to support public infrastructure investments and policy development in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.

The Capital Expenditure Management Division provides financial and policy analysis to support the government in the development of the 10-year infrastructure plan. The 10-year infrastructure plan includes investments in sectors such as health, education, justice, transportation and transit.

The Capital Expenditure Management Division is responsible for analyzing and recommending infrastructure investments through the Province's annual budget process; monitoring and reporting on outcomes and progress on the 10-year infrastructure plan; and analyzing and implementing appropriate infrastructure investment strategies.

The position is located at Queen's Park in downtown Toronto. Job to be completed remotely for the foreseeable future. This is subject to change pending OPS policies on a safe return to work

Job Summary:
We are not your typical government job. We work in the Communitech Hub, one of Canada's premier destinations for innovation.

The Ontario Digital Service is improving the online experience for citizens by reinventing crucial government services for the digital age. As a Product Designer, you will help make online government services feel simple, seamless and intuitive.  We work on one major project at a time and we work fast, like Google Design Sprint fast (weekly iterations). On any given day, you may be validating or rejecting a design hypothesis, conducting user research to understand the people and problems you are working to solve for them, or helping to visualize the team's collective ideas.

Our co-op students are those who have the digital skills, mindset, and enthusiasm to support Ontario's Digital Government transformation. During your placement, you will have one-on-one mentorship from the lead designer who will provide advice and continuous guidance throughout your term.

Freedom in the workplace is a crucial part of how we conduct our day-to-day tasks. The expectation is that you will complete your work within the given timeframe; however, you will have the autonomy to do so without being limited to a 9-5 workday.

Join us and help make government work better for people by delivering simple and straightforward digital services and products. We provide employees with constructive feedback to foster their career growth, and opportunities to collaborate with talented people.
Job Responsibilities:
Your impact

You will be an advocate for the user, asking the tough questions to help hypothesize, test, iterate (and occasionally fail) at creating novel user-centred solutions that address long-standing issues.
You will use applied perceptiveness and critical thinking to not only solve problems, but find problems, and expose the assumptions that are at the centre of key service design issues.
You will play a leadership role in preserving our studio culture, using open communication and participatory methods to share, critique and improve not only our work, but our way of working.
You will use your skills as a designer strategically, drawing upon tenants of visual design, behavioural economics, and human-computer interaction to create delightful user experiences.
Required Skills:
What you bring to the team

You think digital by default and embrace new ideas that put users first in order to find the best solutions.
You believe diversity and inclusion helps create the best conditions for people to achieve the best results, knowing the best ideas come from everywhere and everyone
You work in a team, but can execute tasks independently
You anticipate issues and proactively address them
You take initiative and step up to support the team; no task is too big or small!
You enjoy working in an agile work environment

UX design skills

Simply put, you have an eye for design. This isn't just about making things pretty, it is about understanding how to leverage design strategically, and for the desired impact.
You have experience using prototyping software, such as Figma, Balsamiq, Adobe XD, Sketch, InVision, or similar
You understand that good designs start with content design, including information architecture
You have a knack for writing microcopy

 User research skills

You are not afraid to test your ideas early, and often
You are familiar with, and ideally, have used, a range of user research and user testing techniques such one to one interviews, card sorting, ethnographic studies, usability testing, etc.
You have experience taking the outputs of user research activities and incorporating them into product iterations

Job Summary:
Trend Micro, a global leader in cybersecurity, is passionate about making the world safe for exchanging digital information today and in the future. Artfully applying our XGen security strategy, our innovative solutions for consumers, businesses, and governments deliver connected security for data centers, cloud workloads, networks, and endpoints.
 
Optimized for leading environments, including Amazon Web Services, Microsoft®, and VMware®, our layered solutions enable organizations to automate the protection of valuable information from today's threats. Our connected threat defense enables seamless sharing of threat intelligence and provides centralized visibility and investigation to make organizations their most resilient. 
 
With over 6,500 employees in 50 countries and the world's most advanced global threat research and intelligence, Trend Micro enables organizations to secure their connected world. www.trendmicro.com

What sets us apart:

Trend provides opportunities to pursue personal growth, training and continued development
Employees are encouraged to thrive, fail safely, learn from mistakes and grow
Use of innovative technologies like Cloud, Microservices, Docker, Kubernetes and DevOps
Frequent team activities, project celebrations and knowledge sharing
Regular Hack Days!
Global company, global opportunities
Job Responsibilities: Your role will be to design, implement and test high quality software capabilities for data center and cloud based systems using your excellent coding abilities. This is a software development role requiring exceptional programming skills and a high degree of adaptability and creativity. If you love writing beautiful, efficient, and productive code, and have a desire to see your code deliver great value, we want to talk to you.

Will work on a variety of platforms at varying heights in the stack, and at any level of the software pipeline
Is quality focused, believes in unit testing and making their code easily debuggable in the field, and believes the best tests are coded and performed by a machine

Job Summary:
Job Summary
Do you want to work on an app or help build Ironman? Trexo Robotics is a wearable robotics start-up working towards making mobility a reality for the disabled and elderly. Our first product is a robot for children with movement disorders such as Cerebral Palsy and it allows kids to walk, in many cases for the first time in their lives. The device is currently being used by families and the best hospitals across North America.

As a Robot Builder, you will assist in building Trexo's from start to finish while ensuring they all meet high quality control standards and testing. You will work directly with our engineering and supply chain teams to ensure we meet our production schedule and can improve on it.
 
Our work doesn't stop here, we are constantly working towards building mobility solutions for all. At Trexo Robotics you will find a flat organization where you can work with highly optimistic, low ego and exceptionally talented individuals who look forward to solving hard problems.

Build sub assemblies and complete Trexo devices.
Complete sub assembly and full device testing (software, electrical, mechanical).
Assist with maintaining inventory and inbound/outbound shipping.
Create assembly and testing plans for sub assemblies and full assemblies.
Work on QC and QA for incoming shipments.
Required Skills:

Relevant experience building complex electromechanical systems.
You have exceptional communication skills.
Experience creating complex spreadsheets.
Experience working with 13485 standard.
You are extremely organized and do not let anything slip through.
You are detail oriented and methodical.
You thrive in unknown situations. You can solve immediate crises while creating and implementing procedures, so they do not happen in the future.
Excellent interpersonal skills and high levels of emotional intelligence.

Experience looking at engineering drawings, electrical schematics and creating QA/QC documentation.

Knowledge of Mandarin

Job Summary:
Applanix has been involved in providing navigation systems to autonomous vehicles since the days of the DARPA Grand Challenges and has continued to this day to provide reliable positioning solutions to both land and aerial autonomy platforms. The engineering intern will work closely with a young and dynamic team of mobile roboticists at Applanix to support the development of the Applanix Autonomy Development Platform. Major components of this platform include the Applanix POS, Applanix's lidar navigation and perception solution, and interfaces to the above components. Experience working in a Linux operating systems, working with Robotic Operating System (ROS), and programming proficiency in C++, and any dev ops related experiences are sought skillsets. Engineering or Computer Science students with interests in navigation technologies for autonomous vehicles should apply. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to work with data from off-road applications that is atypical from any massive open online courses on self-driving cars. Applanix is located in the north of the Greater Toronto Area (GTA). Perks include free lunch-time yoga classes, and on-site recreation facilities with indoor soccer, tennis and basketball courts. 

 Founded on defense and aerospace industry expertise, and a Trimble company since 2003, our Position and Orientation Systems (POS?) have become the world's industry-standard for airborne, land, marine, and indoor mobile survey operations. With global reach, unequaled engineering excellence, and worldwide 24/7 customer support, Applanix leads the world in high-productivity in-motion surveying, direct data georeferencing, robust mobile mapping, and real-time navigation for autonomy applications. Applanix POS, as well as our lidar navigation and perception technologies are now powering new revolutions in both autonomous vehicle and mobile mapping in GNSS-denied spaces. 

Applanix is committed to an Accessible workplace and provides an Accessible recruitment process. Please note that we can accommodate disabilities upon request. Please let us know if you require any accommodations.
Job Responsibilities:
Responsibilities

Code refactoring and improvements and running static code analysis
Navigation and perception feature performance analysis using autonomy datasets
Implement new (automated) integration and regression tests
Assist in improving our continuous integration pipeline
Develop drivers for evaluating new perception sensors
Required Skills:
Qualifications

Enrolment in computer, electrical, mechatronics eng, or computer science
Familiar with modern C++ (11), and good coding practice
Python and / or shell scripting experience
Experience using Linux, and ROS (not required, but desired)
Enthusiasm towards autonomy, self-driving technologies

Job Summary:
TRIUMF
Canada's National Laboratory for Particle and Nuclear Physics STUDENT JOB PROGRAM Summer 2021 job posting Job number TR21-2-4
 
Student job title:
     REMOTE - Junior Data Scientist
 
Name of project:
     Deep Learning for Event Reconstruction in Water Cherenkov Detectors
 
Overview:
     Neutrino oscillations are the only experimentally verified observation
     of a process not described by the Standard Model of particle physics.
     Since their discovery in 1998 we have learnt a lot about the
     parameters that govern these oscillations, but there are still many
     questions remaining. Perhaps the most exciting of these is to
     determine whether neutrino oscillations violate charge-parity (CP)
     symmetry, and so could potentially explain why we live in a
     matter-dominated universe.
     The T2K experiment and Nobel prize-winning Super-Kamiokande experiment
     are powerful tools for exploring neutrino oscillations. The next
     generation Hyper-Kamiokande experiment, coming online in the middle of
     the decade, has significant discovery potential for CP violation, as
     well as other phenomena such as proton decay, supernovae and other
     multi-messenger astronomical events, and dark matter. The Canadian
     group is working on a number of interesting R&D efforts aimed towards
     maximizing the potential of Hyper-K.
    
     A background and a source of major systematic uncertainty in the CP
     violation analysis is caused by events where a gamma ray is produced
     in a neutrino interaction instead of the usual charged lepton
     (electron). Supervised deep learning techniques such as Convolutional
     Neural Networks and PointNets have been developed within the research
     group and incorporation of these methods in a statistical analysis is
     being developed currently to estimate to what precision Neutral
     Current gamma interaction rate (cross-section) could be measured.
     Another class of background events is present when a neutral pion
     (pi0) is produced. Typically these types of events result in a
     double-ring topology. Current effort within the group concentrates on
     panoptic segmentation of the event data to distinguish multiple
     Cherenkov rings. During the course of the project the student will
     develop one-shot classification method for the pi0 events and a method
     based on prior segmentation of the event and evaluate performance of
     the alternatives. Time permitting, generative deep learning methods
     can be applied to limit the impact of systematic effects or to improve
     the classifier training process. Such methods will include Generative
     Adversarial Networks (GANs) and their variants such as CycleGANs. The
     successful completion of the project will have a substantial impact on
     key scientific goals of both the Super-K and Hyper-K experiment, such
     as the CP violation measurement and other areas of particle physics
     and astronomy.
Job Responsibilities:
Duties:
     Major duties include:
     - Development and tuning of deep learning models for analysis of water
     Cherenkov data.
    
     - Development and deployment of statistical data analysis tools.
Required Skills:
Skills learned during this work experience:
     - Experience in many aspects of a complicated physics problem. This
     will range from low level understanding of photosensors to the
     description of the high level capabilities of a next-generation
     neutrino experiment.
     - Machine learning concepts and experience with deep learning
     libraries such as pytorch
    
     - Experience with generative deep learning methods
    
     - Critical thinking and problem solving
    
     - Presentation skills from reports in regular meetings at national and
     international levels                                                 

Qualifications:
     We are looking for a motivated physics student to work on an exciting
     high-energy physics project. The core skills that we are looking for
     include:
     - Strong competence in the use of computational methods for data
     analysis.
    
     - Ability to quickly learn new software tools and software packages.
    
     - Experience with using Linux OS.
    
     - Python programming experience.
    
     - Experience with numerical libraries numpy, matplotlib
    
     - Understanding of machine learning and deep learning concepts.
    
     - Experience with deep learning and machine learning frameworks e.g.
     pytorch, scikit-learn
    
     - Senior undergraduate level knowledge of Quantum Mechanics and
     electromagnetism
    
     - Ability to independently solve problems and investigate
     alternatives.
    
     Beneficial skills would include:
    
     - Understanding of the basics of a particle physics detector.
    
     - Understanding of concepts in probability theory and statistics.
    
     - C++ programming experience
    
     - Experience with batch processing systems (slurm, torque)
    
     - Experience with versioning tools (git)                             
                                                                           
Shiftwork required: No
 
Period of Work: May-August 2021, with possible 4-month extension

Job Summary:
TRIUMF
Canada's National Laboratory for Particle and Nuclear Physics STUDENT JOB PROGRAM Summer 2021 job posting Job number TR21-2-5
 
Student job title:
     REMOTE - Quantum Machine Learning Researcher
 
Name of project:
     Quantum Machine Learning for Simulation of Calorimetric Detectors at
     the Large Hadron Colliders
 
Overview:
     Particle physics experiments at the Large Hadron Collider (LHC) study
     the fundamental building blocks of the Universe and interactions
     between them. TRIUMF scientists are leading efforts in multiple
     aspects of the ATLAS experiment at the Large Hadron Collider
     including detector development, data acquisition and data analysis
     including machine learning applications. During the High Luminosity
     run of the LHC (anticipated to start in the late 2020s) ATLAS
     experiment will require tens of millions of CPU years per year, mostly
     spent in providing simulation and reconstruction of simulated data.
     Deep Learning methods are already becoming a critical part of such
     simulations and LHC data analysis.
    
     In the proposed project student's objective will be to use a method
     combining 'classical' Deep Learning methods with the unique
     capabilities of quantum annealing processors to create a quantum
     variational autoencoders (QVAEs) generating simulated outputs such as
     those of the calorimeters of the ATLAS experiment.
     During the course of the project generic simulated electromagnetic
     calorimeter will be generated, progressing to a hadronic calorimeter
     with an option to generate actual ATLAS calorimetric cluster. Time
     permitting simulation of calorimeter response to collimated particle
     showers (called 'jets') will be simulated.
     Successful completion of the project would have outsize impact on the
     field of particle physics, most notably on the study of the Higgs
     Boson.
Job Responsibilities:
Duties:
     Duties of the student will include
    
     - Development and adaptation of machine learning and quantum machine
     learning techniques for generation of synthetic calorimeter samples
     (calorimetric simulation)
    
     - Training and tuning of the models
     
     - Deployment on a quantum annealing processor
    
     - Tuning of annealing parameters
    
     - Evaluation of the performance of the developed models
    
     - Collaboration with particle physicists and machine learning experts
    
     - Presentations, oral and written reports to peers and experts in the
     field
Required Skills:
Skills learned during this work experience:
     - Fundamental and technical expertise in generative methods,
     particularly for quantum annealing processors
    
     - Critical thinking and problem solving
    
     - Expert level knowledge of deep learning libraries
    
     - Oral and written presentation skills; Scientific communication
    
Qualifications:
     The position targets a senior undergraduate in an Joint Physics and
     Computer Science, Engineering-Physics, Computer Science, Computer and
     Electrical Engineering or similar program.
    
     Ideally the candidate will have completed at least two work terms.
    
     Qualifications required:
    
     - Strong knowledge of physics curriculum at senior undergraduate
     level.
    
     - Strong background in python programming.
    
     - Experience with numerical and machine learning libraries in python:
     numpy, matplotlib, scikit-learn
    
     - Strong knowledge of statistics and machine learning concepts.
    
     - Strong knowledge of deep learning concepts,  particularly generative
     models (VAEs).
    
     - Strong technical background in at least one deep learning library
     pytorch, tf
    
     Beneficial experience:
    
     - Experience with versioning tools (git)
    
     - Experience with pytorch deep learning library
    
     - Experience with batch processing systems (slurm, torque)
    
     - C++ programming experience
 
Shiftwork required: No
 
Period of Work: May-August 2021, with possible 4-month extension

Job Title:
NEW
									



										ALPHA Antimatter Simulation Undergraduate Research Student
Job Summary:
TRIUMF
Canada's National Laboratory for Particle and Nuclear Physics STUDENT JOB PROGRAM Summer 2021 job posting Job number TR21-2-6
 
Student job title:
     [REMOTE] ALPHA Antimatter Simulation Undergraduate Research Student
 
Name of project:
     Numerical Simulations for the Next Generation Antimatter Project
     ALPHA-HAICU
    
Overview:
     ALPHA-Canada is  an experimental collaboration between a number of
     Canadian universities and laboratories (UBC, Calgary, SFU, TRIUMF,
     York), Our new initiative HAICU is aiming to develop a next-generation
     apparatus to precisely probe the properties of anithydrogen and
     hydrogen atoms in a free-falling fountain. The apparatus first
     prepares the (anti-)atoms in a small, high-gradient magnetic trap,
     decreases their energy with Doppler laser cooling, then transfers them
     to a magnetic trap with lower gradient and larger volume. This
     expansion adiabatically cools the (anti-)atoms far below the Doppler
     cooling limit. The (anti-)atoms are then launched into a region free
     from any magnetic perturbation, and various coherent quantum
     techniques can be used to precisely measure the properties of the
     (anti-)atoms during the subsequent free-fall. These techniques include
     Raman interferometry, used to measure gravitational acceleration, and
     Ramsey interferometry, used to measure transition frequencies.
Job Responsibilities:
Duties:
     The student will work remotely with ALPHA scientists to refine
     numerical models used to simulate the behaviour of (anti-)atoms in the
     magnetic trap. The models include a magnetic field interpolator, used
     to propagate field from a pre-computed grid to the position of
     individual particles, and a particle pusher, used to evolve particle
     position using the field. The student will evaluate the precision of
     both models as a function of computational and memory cost, and
     introduce refinements where applicable.
Required Skills:
Skills learned during this work experience:
     - Antimatter physics
    
     - Particle trap physics
    
     - Superconducting magnet engineering and modelling
    
     - Numerical techniques for particle simulation
    
     - Experience with high performance computing and parallel programming
    
     - Working on an Internationally high profile project
     
     - Public presentation skills
 
Qualifications:
     Working knowledge of c++ or similar object-oriented (OO) languages is
     required, with emphasis on OO programming style. Basic knowledge with
     numerical discretisation of differential equations is also needed.
     Familiarity with computational physics is a plus. Entry level
     electromagnetism education in differential form (e.g. Griffiths) is
     also a bonus.
 
Shiftwork required: No
 
Period of Work: May - Aug, with possible 4-month extension

Job Title:
NEW
									



										Researcher in Theoretical/Computational Subatomic Physics
Job Summary:
TRIUMF
Canada's National Laboratory for Particle and Nuclear Physics STUDENT JOB PROGRAM Summer 2021 job posting Job number TR21-2-8
 
Student job title:
     REMOTE - Researcher in theoretical/computational subatomic physics
 
Name of project:
     First principles theory for exotic nuclei with connections to neutrino
     and dark-matter physics
 
Overview:
     This project will focus on the development and application of powerful
     theoretical methods to explore fundamental questions on the structure
     of exotic nuclei, or more far-reaching connections to neutrino and
     dark-matter physics. The student will first gain familiarity and build
     confidence working with the basic ingredients of such calculations:
     nuclear forces and their connection to the underlying theory of strong
     interactions (quantum chromodynamics), and nuclear many-body methods
     to predict properties of medium-mass nuclei.  Depending on particular
     interests, the student will have the exciting opportunity either to
     design and implement an extension to the existing computational
     infrastructure, work on computationally optimizing existing codes, or
     perform a series of calculations which will confront directly with
     experiments being performed at TRIUMF or other prominent experimental
     facilities across the world.
Job Responsibilities:
Duties:
     The student will perform calculations, organize and interpret results,
     and work on implementing or testing extensions to existing codes. The
     student will also be encouraged to take part in group and lab-wide
     activities, such as colloquia, seminars, and journal clubs, and to
     interact with experimental colleagues, with whom they will have daily
     contact on-site at TRIUMF.
Required Skills:
Skills learned during this work experience:
     The student will learn to run and interpret leading-edge nuclear
     theory calculation, where emphasis will be placed on organizing and
     effectively communicating scientific results. With the latest advances
     in high-performance computing and optimization algorithms at her/his
     disposal, the student will gain experience with parallel-computing
     techniques such as OpenMP and MPI and work on some of the world's
     largest supercomputers.  Finally, there will be ample opportunities to
     further hone scientific writing and presentation skills.
 
Qualifications:
     The ideal applicant will have mastered material encountered in
     introductory quantum mechanics courses and be familiar with concepts
     such as eigenvalues, wavefunctions, operators, unitary
     transformations, and angular-momentum algebra. Furthermore, some
     computing experience is required, with fluency in either C++
     (preferred) or Fortran highly desirable.
 
Shiftwork required: No
 
Period of Work: May to August (or December) - 4 or 8 month term, with possible 4-month extension

Job Title:
NEW
									



										Simulations and Experiment Development for the TRIUMF UCN Source and TUCAN EDM
Job Summary:
TRIUMF
Canada's National Laboratory for Particle and Nuclear Physics STUDENT JOB PROGRAM Summer 2021 job posting Job number TR21-2-9
 
Student job title:
     REMOTE or ON-SITE - Simulations and experiment development for the
     TRIUMF UCN source and TUCAN EDM
 
Name of project:
     Simulations and experiment development for the TRIUMF UCN source and
     the neutron EDM project
 
Overview:
     Knowledge of fundamental properties of the neutron helps to understand
     many aspects of the universe. It all starts right after the Big Bang:
     matter wins over antimatter in the universe, making our existence
     possible. One essential ingredient for this matter-antimatter
     asymmetry is violation of a more fundamental symmetry, called CP
     violation. This, in turn might show up in a non-zero electric dipole
     moment (EDM) of the neutron, making EDM measurements the flagship of
     fundamental neutron physics.
     About 100 s after the Big Bang, the relevance of the neutron
     properties continues: neutron beta-decay lifetime plays an important
     role in primordial nucleosynthesis, influencing, e.g., the helium
     abundance in the Universe significantly. If neutron lifetime results
     are combined with experiments determining other decay parameters of
     the neutron, important coupling constants of the weak interaction of
     fundamental particles can be determined.These are important for our
     understanding of solar models and tests of the Standard Model of
     particle physics.
     Owing to its neutrality and long lifetime of around 15 min, one can
     also look very carefully at the gravitational interaction of neutrons,
     thus probing the quantum mechanical features of the gravity potential;
     in turn, this puts constraints on non-Newtonian gravity models.
     All the experiments above have in common the need for very slow
     neutrons, called ultra-cold neutrons (UCN). We are presently building
     a new UCN source driving TRIUMF's new UCN facility. Opportunities
     exist for an undergraduate student to contribute in a significant way
     to the electric dipole moment experiment or the UCN facility start-up.
Job Responsibilities:
Duties:
     The student will work on simulations of ultracold neutrons in magnetic
     and electric fields and on the design of the high-voltage cell for the
     neutron EDM experiment. This work will be carried out in a team
     environment with physicists and graduate students from TRIUMF and the
     Universities of British Columbia (UBC), Winnipeg (UW), Manitoba (UM),
     Osaka (RCNP) and Tokio (KEK).
Required Skills:
Skills learned during this work experience:
     For the particle simulation tasks the student will get familiar with
     Monte Carlo methods and particle spin-tracking. During the
     experimental and design tasks skills learned will be related to vacuum
     techniques, cryogenics, high-voltage and neutron depolarization
     requirements for the neutron EDM experiment.
     Additionally, participation in our weekly international status
     meetings for the UCN source and EDM experiment is highly recommended
     for the student to get introduced into the international
     collaboration.
     We are providing a stimulating environment for students to learn new
     things while contributing significantly to the progress of the
     project.                                                             

Qualifications:
     Third or Fourth year physics, engineering (Eng.Phys.) with some
     experimental experience. Experience using CAD software (ideally
     SolidWorks) is recommended. Some experience using FEA software (e.g.
     ANSYS, Opera, FEMM) and C++ (or equivalent) and working in a
     Linux-based environment would be advantageous for the simulation work.
     Affinity for experimental techniques and development is what we are
     looking for in an ideal candidate.                                    

Shiftwork required: No
 
Period of Work: May-August 2021, with possible 4-month extension

Job Summary:
TRIUMF
Canada's National Laboratory for Particle and Nuclear Physics STUDENT JOB PROGRAM Summer 2021 job posting Job number TR21-2-2
 
Student job title:
     REMOTE or ONSITE Particle Physics Detector Researcher
 
Name of project:
     Geometrical Calibration of Water Cherenkov Detectors Using
     Photogrammetry
 
Overview:
     Neutrino oscillations are the only experimentally verified observation
     of a process not described by the Standard Model (SM) of particle
     physics. Since their discovery in 1998 we have learnt a lot about the
     parameters that govern these oscillations, but there are still many
     questions remaining. Perhaps the most exciting of these is to
     determine whether neutrino oscillations violate charge-parity (CP)
     symmetry, and so could potentially explain why we live in a
     matter-dominated universe.
    
     The T2K experiment and Nobel prize-winning Super-Kamiokande experiment
     are powerful tools for exploring neutrino oscillations. The next
     generation Hyper-Kamiokande experiment, coming online in the middle of
     next decade, has significant discovery potential for CP violation, as
     well as other phenomenon such as proton decay, supernovae and other
     multi-messenger astronomical events, and dark matter. The Canadian
     group is working on a number of interesting R&D efforts aimed towards
     maximizing the potential of Hyper-K.
     Super-K, Hyper-K, and other interim detectors we are developing,
     employ a large array of very sensitive single-photon sensors to
     observe Cherenkov light emanating from particles produced by a
     neutrino interaction or other event like proton decay. A precise
     knowledge of the relative positioning of all the photosensors and
     calibration sources in the detector is necessary to achieve accurate
     reconstruction of a particle's energy and direction, key parameters in
     a neutrino oscillation measurement. The goal of this particular
     project is to develop a photogrammetry technique for determining the
     positions of photosensors in Super-K and eventually Hyper-K (and its
     intermediate detector). This technique has not yet been widely
     successfully applied to this class of detectors and would be a
     significant innovation in the field, achieving the most precise
     understanding of such a detector to date.
Job Responsibilities:
Duties:
     You will be involved in developing a photogrammetry technique, from
     hardware and operations, to software and analysis. We are evaluating
     and characterizing underwater camera systems and remote operated
     vehicles (ROV) for deployment in Super-K and Hyper-K. Your tasks will
     involve:
    
     - Designing, assembling, testing, and calibrating underwater camera
     systems (may be able to be done on-site, or remotely if local)
     - Operation and calibration of an ROV (may be able to be done on UBC Campus)
     - Photogrammetry analysis for camera calibration, feature recognition,
     and distance measurements
     - Develop improvements in feature recognition algorithms, including
     machine learning (semantic segmentation) applications
     - Compare measurements to known distances to determine accuracy of
     your algorithms
     - Analysis of images taken with the ROV in the Super-K detector
     - Implementation of results in water Cherenkov detector simulation and
     Monte Carlo studies of the effects.
Required Skills:
Skills learned during this work experience:
     - Photography and optics
     - Hardware design and assembly
     - Operation of underwater ROV
     - Critical thinking and problem solving
     - Software and algorithm development, including application of machine
     learning
     - Analysis of data and assessment of statistical and systematic
     uncertainties
     - High-performance cluster computing, big data analysis
     - Presentation skills from reports in regular meetings at national and
     international levels                                                 
 
Qualifications:
     We are looking for a motivated physics or engineering student to work
     on an exciting high-energy physics project. The core skills that we
     are looking for include:
    
     - Careful control and attention to detail in laboratory experiments,
     hardware and electronics projects
    
     - Strong competence in the use of computers for serious analysis.
     - Ability to quickly learn several new computer tools and software
     packages.
     - Proficiency in C++ and Python programming.
     - Experience with SolidWorks or other CAD
     - Experience in rapid and thorough data analysis.
     - Ability to independently solve problems and investigate
     alternatives.                                                        
 
Shiftwork required: No
 
Period of Work: May - Aug 2021, with possible 4-month extension

Job Summary:
TRIUMF
Canada's National Laboratory for Particle and Nuclear Physics STUDENT JOB PROGRAM Summer 2021 job posting Job number TR21-2-3
 
Student job title:
     ON-SITE Photosensor Detector Researcher
 
Name of project:
     Photosensor Test Facility for the Hyper-Kamiokande Project
 
Overview:
     Neutrino oscillations are the only experimentally verified observation
     of a process not described by the Standard Model (SM) of particle
     physics. Since their discovery in 1998 we have learnt a lot about the
     parameters that govern these oscillations, but there are still many
     questions remaining. Perhaps the most exciting of these is to
     determine whether neutrino oscillations violate charge-parity (CP)
     symmetry, and so could potentially explain why we live in a
     matter-dominated universe.
    
     The next generation Hyper-Kamiokande experiment in Japan will be a
     powerful tool for exploring neutrino oscillations, as well as other
     phenomena such as proton decay. It will succeed the currently
     operating Super-Kamiokande and T2K experiments, and come online around
     2027. The Canadian group is working on a number of interesting R&D
     efforts aimed towards the Hyper-K project, including a new prototype
     detector aiming to run in a CERN beam line by 2022.
    
     The goal of this particular project is to assist in the assembly,
     commissioning, and operation of a specialized Photosensor Test
     Facility (PTF) located at TRIUMF. The PTF is designed to allow
     detailed characterization of photomultiplier tubes (PMTs) that are
     capable of detecting single photons. The key features of the PTF are
     the ability to fire laser light at a PMT submerged in water from
     arbitrary angles and directions and measure the reflected laser light
     at various points. We do this using a pair of optical heads that are
     translated/rotated using a motor-controlled gantry system. These
     measurements are crucial for completely understanding the PMT
     response, in order to simulate the Super-K, Hyper-K and prototype
     detectors to the precision necessary for a CP violation discovery.
Job Responsibilities:
Duties:
     - Assist with assembly and potential design of upgrades of PTF
     components, such as gantry system, optical boxes, Helmholtz coils, PMT
     mounts and cabling
    
     - Develop detailed PTF measurement procedures, including position,
     angle, polarization, and magnetic field dependence.
    
     - Assist with many elements of operation, including motor-controllers,
     magnetic field measurements, and electrical pulse digitizers.
    
     - Development and debugging of the modeling of the system with
     simulation code (COMSOL, GEANT4).
    
     - Operate PTF to take data of SK PMTs and newly developed HK
     photosensors, and following analysis (ROOT, Python).
    
     - Improvement of the PTF setup for reduced uncertainties, increased
     flexibility and faster turn-around.
Required Skills:
Skills learned during this work experience:
     - Experience in many aspects of a complicated physics problem. This
     will range from low level work on lab measurement systems and
     electronics, to the description of the high level capabilities of a
     next-generation neutrino experiment.
    
     - Operation of PMTs
    
     - Operation of a complicated precision calibration system
    
     - Critical thinking and problem solving
    
     - Analysis of critical detector data and assessment of statistical and
     systematic uncertainties
    
     - Presentation skills from reports in regular meetings at national and
     international levels
 
Qualifications:
     We are looking for a motivated physics student to work on an exciting
     high-energy physics project. The core skills that we are looking for
     include:
    
     - Demonstrated hands-on hardware experience with careful attention to
     detail
    
     - Strong competence in the use of computers for serious analysis.
    
     - Ability to quickly learn several new computer tools and software
     packages.
    
     - C++ programming experience.
    
     - Basic programming skills.
    
     - Experience in rapid and thorough data analysis.
    
     - Ability to independently solve problems and investigate
     alternatives.
    
     Beneficial skills would include:
    
     - Experience with using Linux OS would be very beneficial.
    
     - Experience with standard HEP software packages, in particular GEANT4
     and ROOT.
    
     - Understanding of the basics of a particle physics detector,
     particularly of photo-multiplier tubes.
 
Shiftwork required: Yes

NEW
									



										ALPHA Antimatter Detector Undergraduate Research Student
Job Summary:
TRIUMF
Canada's National Laboratory for Particle and Nuclear Physics STUDENT JOB PROGRAM Summer 2021 job posting Job number TR21-2-7
 
Student job title:
     [ON-SITE] ALPHA Antimatter Detector Undergraduate Research Student
 
Name of project:
     ALPHA Antimatter Detector Development and Construction
    
 
Overview:
     The ALPHA Antihydrogen experiment is an exciting international project
     located at CERN, European Particle Physics Centre in Geneva. Our goal
     is to perform spectroscopic and gravitational studies on antihydrogen
     (the antimatter counterpart of hydrogen atoms), in order to test
     fundamental symmetries between matter and antimatter. We have recently
     succeeded in confining antihydrogen atoms in a magnetic "bottle", and
     performed the first measurements of its spectrum. The Canadian
     collaboration, consisting of a consortium of universities and
     laboratories (UBC, Calgary, SFU, TRIUMF, York), are playing major
     roles in wide range of the ALPHA activities, from particle detector
     design to precision spectroscopy. We are currently constructing the
     ALPHA-g apparatus, is a new vertical antimatter trap to study the
     gravitational force on antimatter. By dropping antimatter inside our
     trap, we plan to study if antimatter falls in the same way as matter
     does.
Job Responsibilities:
Duties:
     The student will be based at TRIUMF to work on one or more of the
     following projects related to antimatter physics: (1) Development and
     construction of sophisticated antimatter detector and related
     electronics systems. (2) Design and optimization of the detectors for
     the antimatter gravity experiment, which might entail computer
     simulations using GEANT4. (3) Analyses of the experimental data using
     ROOT software package. The student is expected to participate in
     regular video meetings with CERN, and to present their progress.
Required Skills:
Skills learned during this work experience:
     The skills the students will acquire may include:
    
     - Antimatter physics
    
     - Particle detector development
    
     - Electronics development and testing
    
     - Analysis, modelling, and simulation skills
    
     - Working on an Internationally high profile project
    
     - Public presentation skills
 
Qualifications:
     Hands-on hardware experience in experimental physics is desirable.
     Some experience in working with electronics is a must. Previous
     experience in working on a nuclear or particle physics experiment, C++
     programming, ROOT analysis package, simulations with GEANT4, as well
     as knowledge of Unix-like operation system, is considered an asset. A
     strong interest in making important contributions to antimatter
     research and the ability to work independently is desired.
 
Shiftwork required: Yes
 
Period of Work: May - Aug, with possible 4-month extension
