Job Summary:
The Instructional Support Group (ISG) is seeking an enthusiastic and dependable person to assume a valuable role in the CS 136 teaching team. 

Instructional Support Assistants (ISAs) provide primary student contact, serving as consultants for course-related material through consulting hours. They also have an opportunity to gain teaching experience by helping deliver tutorial  sessions, if desired.  Other duties include assignment marking, providing feedback to instructors on the design and wording of assignments and exams;  assisting in exam proctoring and marking.
Job Responsibilities:
CS 136 is the followup course to CS 135.  It uses both the functional language Racket and the imperative language C in order to discuss real-world issues of expressivity, efficiency, modularity, and code re-use. While it is aimed at CS majors, many non-majors also take the course.

The ISA will help with development work relating to tutorials, marking schemes, automarking tests, and assistance in helping students make the transition from a graphical IDE to a Unix command-line environment. They will need to anticipate difficulties and move to minimize them, and to work relatively independently yet in accordance with the overall philosophy of the course as envisioned by the instructor.
Required Skills:
Potential ISAs must have successfully completed three university-level Computer Science courses.
Experience with at least one of Racket and C would be helpful, preferably both.
Communication skills, critical thinking, and the ability to successfully interact with a wide range of people (undergraduates, graduate IAs and TAs, academic staff, professors) will be crucial.

Job Summary: Working with graduate students and faculty in software engineering on a project that uses compiler technology to extract "facts" from source code (or other software artifacts), uses automated reasoners to query and reason about the "factbase" for the purpose of identifying problems in the software system, and visualizes the results of the query.
Job Responsibilities:
Job responsibilities will depend on the background of the hired applicant, and may include one or more of the following:  
(1) Working on parsers for languages (e.g., Clang) to extract from the AST "facts" about the parsed artefact,
(2) Experimenting with existing data representations and reasoners for factbases.
(3) Assisting with experiments that evaluate the precision, utility, and efficiency of these analyzers on real software systems. (4) Implementing and evaluating ways of visualizing analysis results.
Required Skills:
The ideal candidate is someone who has:

experience working with parsers, and code generation or APIs on AST
interests in and aptitude for formal modelling and automated reasoning about software
interests and experience with information visualization.

A teaching team consists of the course instructors,Instructional Support Assistants (ISAs), and graduate Teaching Assistants and Instructional Apprentices.
Job Responsibilities: CS 100 ISAs will provide the primary student contact related to modules and assignments, including guidance, feedback and marking. ISAs will also provide consulting hours in lab for students who have access to the UW main campus. Secondary duties might include monitoring the course discussion groups, maintaining the course web site, and assisting with the development of course materials.
Required Skills:
To qualify for this position: 

You should have completed at least one university-level computing course (such as CS100, CS115, CS135, CS200).
Familiarity with a variety of software applications and web tools, especially spreadsheets, HTML, XML, search engines and wikis, is an asset as is some programming knowledge.
Our ideal teaching team consists of a mix of people with different strengths; technical superiority is not a requirement of this position, only a desire to learn and a desire to teach others.
Excellent communication, interpersonal and time management skills are critical to success in this position.
Previous leadership experience (such as teaching or coaching) is a definite asset.


Note that Fall 2009 was the first offering of a newly revised CS 100 course: Introduction to Computing through Applications, focusing on effective use of spreadsheets; introduction to the Internet, World Wide Web, HTML, and XML; components of web search engines and their influence on data access; using wikis to publish, reshape, and organize data collaboratively

Job Summary: The Instructional Support Group (ISG) is seeking enthusiastic and dependable people to assume valuable roles in the CS 116 teaching team. The teaching team consists of course instructors, an Instructional Support Coordinator (ISC) graduate Instructional Apprentices (IAs), graduate Teaching Assistants (TAs) and Instructional Support Assistants (ISAs).
Job Responsibilities:
ISAs provide the primary student contact, serving as consultants for course-related material through office hours. They also have anopportunity to gain teaching experience by leading
tutorial sessions.  In addition, tutors gain organizational experience by co-ordinating the activities of the graduate teaching assistants assigned to the course. Other duties include creation of marking schemes and automarking tests, providing feedback to instructors on the design and wording of tutorials, assignments, and exams, and assisting in proctoring and marking.

CS 116 is the follow-up course for CS 115.  It is open to all students across campus (except CS majors, who take CS 136 or CS 146), regardless of prior experience. It uses subsets of the programming language Racket as well as Python, providing further exposure to functional programming, an introduction to imperative programming, and basic coverage of important issues in computer science.
Required Skills:
Potential ISAs must have successfully completed two university-level Computer Science courses, and either know or be willing to rapidly master Racket and Python. 
The Macintosh platform is used in labs; experience with Macs, though beneficial, is not required. 
Exposure to scripting is also an asset.
Successful candidates will have good communication and interpersonal skills, and the judgement and ability to work both independently and in collaboration with others, in accordance with the overall course goals and philosophy

Job Summary:
The Instructional Support Group requires an Instructional Support Assistant (ISA) to assist in the delivery of  CS 240E as part of a team of instructors, graduate Instructional Apprentices (IAs), graduate Teaching Assistants (TAs) and an Instructional Support Coordinator (ISC).

CS 240E is an enriched version of CS 240 offered in the Winter and Spring terms, if there is sufficient demand.

The intended audience is interested Computer Science students who have earned a grade of 85% or higher in CS 145, or 90% or higher in both CS 135 and CS 136.
Job Responsibilities:
The Instructional Support Assistant (ISA) provides the primary student contact, serving as a consultant for course-related material through consulting hours and on-line communication. ISAs also provide feedback to instructors on assignments and other course materials and contribute to a quality learning experience for students. There is an opportunity to gain teaching experience by giving tutorials. The ISA may also develop these tutorials. Experience will be gained as co-ordinator of the assignment marking activities of the TAs assigned to the course.  Other duties may include creation of model solutions and marking schemes, and creation of scripts needed for assignment testing and auto-marking. The ISA also assists with proctoring and marking exams, and performs various other tasks to ensure the smooth running of the course. Training, mentoring and other resources are provided and there is the opportunity for growth in many areas, technical, personal and interpersonal, depending on the individual.

This position may be of particular interest to students who are considering graduate school and ultimately teaching at the post-secondary level.
Required Skills:
Good communication, time management and interpersonal skills, attention to detail and a proactive work attitude are required.
Familiarity with Linux and C++
Experience with a statically-typed functional programming language would be an asset.
Students currently enrolled in the course are encouraged to apply.

Job Summary:
The Groundwater Geochemistry and Remediation Research Group in the Department of Earth and Environmental Sciences at the University of Waterloo is currently seeking applicants for an undergraduate co-op student research assistant position. The student will mainly assist research group members with the development of figures and diagrams relating to groundwater geochemistry, contaminant fate and remediation.

This role also has the potential to include work in our geochemistry labs on the University of Waterloo campus as well as participate in field work at remote sites in northern Ontario and elsewhere in Canada, contingent on the restrictions surrounding COVID-19.
Job Responsibilities:
This position will be primarily completed remotely with the potential for field and lab-based work.  

The student will be responsible for communicating with researchers and working independently to create and edit scientific figures and diagrams from collected data, this may involve the use of software such as CorelDraw and Microsoft Excel. The successful applicant is expected to work independently and as part of a team with technicians and graduate students.

Pending easing of COVID-19 field and laboratory access restrictions, the student will be responsible for the general upkeep and daily maintenance of various experiments in a wet chemistry laboratory and will assist with sample collection and analysis. In addition, the student may be required to participate in field work at remote sites in northern Ontario and elsewhere in Canada. Tasks will include field and laboratory collection of water and solid-phase samples, measurement of geochemical parameters and dissolved constituents (e.g., pH, Eh, alkalinity, ammonia, phosphate, sulfide), conducting microbial enumerations, and assisting with field-site instrumentation. The successful applicant is expected to work independently and as part of a team with technicians and graduate students. This position requires proper handling and use of toxic substances, concentrated inorganic acids, and compressed gases. Job-specific safety training will be provided for field and laboratory activities as needed.
Required Skills:
Applicants should have:

Completed university-level introductory chemistry
Some experience using Microsoft Excel and CorelDraw.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters

				- Theme - Scientific Experimental Design and Laboratory Assistance
				
			
				ENG - Civil, Environmental and Geological Engineering
				
			
				SCI - Chemical Sciences
				
			
				SCI - Earth, Environmental and Geological Sciences

Job Summary: Wastewater-based epidemiology (WBE) has been recognized as a potential tool to monitor trends in community infection of COVID-19. Isolation of gene fragments of the viral RNA from the wastewater followed by quantification using RT-qPCR has been demonstrated as a sensitive method.  We are currently working with various waste water treatment plants (WWTPs) to collect influent and effluent and quantify for the presence of COVID-19.  The student will be preparing coolers and samples, driving to the WWTPs to collect samples, sample processing and extraction and possibly helping with qPCR.
Job Responsibilities:
* Sample collection at various waste water treatment plants
			* Preparation of sample bottles and coolers.
			* Preparing reagents and tubes for extractions.
			* Processing samples upon arrival at campus.
			* Centrifugation of waste water samples.
			* Extraction of RNA from waste water samples using a kit.
			* Maintaining databases and data collection.
			* Valid G drivers license is required and should be comfortable driving large trucks (F150).
Required Skills:
* Meticulous note taking and attention to detail
			* Communication.
			* Time management.
			* Flexibility to work odd hours as needed.
			* Pipetting.
			* qPCR knowledge is not required but is an asset.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Scientific Experimental Design and Laboratory Assistance
				
			
				SCI - Biological Sciences

Job Summary:
The Human Resources Department is responsible for assisting in the provision and maintenance of a positive working environment for all university employees, which will foster achievement of the University's primary goals of teaching and research, through excellent client service.  In addition, Human Resources supports the opportunity for employees to reach their potential and achieve excellence through the effective administration and interpretation of corporate policies and practices, applicable federal and provincial legislation as well as its involvement in the administration and delivery of programs for personal and professional growth.
 
The department provides service to the campus community in the areas of pension and benefit administration, salary administration, recruitment, career counseling and training and development.  Human Resources bases its service on the principles of equity and confidentiality with an emphasis on excellence in both customer service and employee relations.
 
The Pension Assistant is responsible for providing support to the Pension team and works closely with the members of the Pension Team, and will interact with all areas within Human Resources, as well as active and retired plan members.
Job Responsibilities:
- Prepare pension calculations, letters, and statements for members, follow-up with members who have not returned completed forms
- Prepare pension payment directions and reconcile benefit payments to pension fund statements
- Respond to pension inquiries by email and telephone
- Assist developing pension presentations and compiling evaluation information afterwards
- Assist with monthly data cleansing
- Assist with special pension projects
- Input data and complete forms as required and assist with filing confidential information and paperwork
Required Skills:
- Computer literate, specifically Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and Excel
- Excellent oral and written communication skills
- Data analysis and strong math skills required
- Aptitude for accuracy and attention to detail is required
- Previous experience in customer service, working with elders, and office environment is an asset

Job Summary:
As a Content Migration Specialist you will be participating in all migration-related activities as a part of the Waterloo Content Management System (WCMS) upgrade project. You will have an opportunity to work with a broad range of faculties, departments, and academic support units on campus. You will also receive training and mentorship from an experienced team of training and support professionals, and web developers. If you are a detail-oriented, collaborative person looking for an opportunity to do highly-impactful work that will be greatly valued by countless campus stakeholders, then this role may be for you. 

Please note that this position will very likely be remote for the Spring 2021 term. You will need a computer with a webcam, though equipment can be supplied if needed if you are in the Waterloo area. Access to a quiet area, and/or headphones are also recommended. The successful candidate(s) must be available to work between approximately 8:30 AM - 4:30 PM eastern time.
Job Responsibilities:
- Assist points-of-contact (POCs) and site owners with pre-migration activities 
- Assist Training and Support Lead and Client Support Specialist with WCMS 3 training activities as needed 
- Test new features in WCMS 3 and provide feedback 
- Participate in mock migrations and provide feedback 
- Assist site maintainers in remediating web content accessibility issues 
- Provide quality assurance testing as needed 
- Monitor and respond to client inquiries through our support inbox
Required Skills:
- Strong attention to detail 
- Proficient with Microsoft Excel, experience with other Microsoft O365 tools is an asset 
- An ability to work both collaboratively, and independently 
- Previous experience working with website content in a CMS (e.g. WordPress, Drupal) is an asset, but not required 
- Previous experience providing training and support for software and/or web technologies is an asset, but not required

Job Title:
NEW
									



										Quantum Outreach and Optics Research Assistant
Job Summary:
The primary purpose of the Outreach Research Assistant is to build and develop hands-on demonstrations of quantum technologies for use in IQC's workshops. In particular, the successful candidate will be responsible for developing workshops for a research-grade photon pair source based on nonlinear optics for demonstrating two-photon entanglement and quantum key distribution. The successful candidate will also have the opportunity to deliver workshops on quantum technologies to student audiences, and develop an essential skillset for quantum optics research.

Due to COVID-19 restrictions, this role may shift focus to developing online materials and simulations, as well as assisting with online outreach activities, depending on government and university recommendations and regulations.
Job Responsibilities:
Building demonstrations for quantum education

Through guided research, understand the physical principles and real-world necessities
In the lab, put together and fine-tune/align optical components
Ensure proper working order and robustness through benchmarking tests
Design and test components using 3D printing and electronics
Build plug-and-play extensions to core components (e.g. entangled photon source) for educational experiments
Design control and user-end software for both testing and educational use

Writing a lab manual for entangled photon tests

Translate learned background information into an introductory notebook for future classes
Develop a guide to the experiment for future students and facilitators
Co-develop discussion questions to solidify gained knowledge

Outreach and education

Assist with the delivery of workshops on quantum technologies to high-school students
Assist with the planning and setup of various educational and public-facing events and workshops
Develop ideas for further hands-on educational demonstrations

Virtual learning

Help design and develop online activities and simulations in, for example, HTML5 and Javascript
Help run and moderate workshops and events for students, teachers, and the public

Due to the scheduling of outreach events, some weekend and evening work will be required. Any requirements outside of normal working hours will be planned well in advance.
Required Skills:
Education

Pursuing a university degree in physics.

Experience

200-level or above quantum physics and optics courses are a strong asset.
Prior experience in an optics laboratory is not necessary, but is an asset.

Knowledge/Skills/Abilities

Familiarity with concepts in quantum physics, e.g. superposition, entanglement
Ability to communicate scientific ideas effectively to broad audiences
Ability to work independently
Ability to leave detailed and legible lab notes and reports for both supervisors and future users
Able to work as part of a multi-disciplinary team
Pre-existing knowledge of programming in Python, Mathematica, HTML5, Javascript or Unity is an asset (but not essential)
Pre-existing knowledge of experimental design and acquisition software, such as AutoCAD, LabView, and Arduino interfacing, is an asset (but not essential)
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Scientific Experimental Design and Laboratory Assistance
				
			
				SCI - Physics
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Cover Letter,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
The primary purpose of the Quantum Optics Research Assistant is to build and develop hands-on demonstrations of quantum technologies for use in upper-year and Masters'-level labs at the University of Waterloo. In particular, the successful candidate will be responsible for developing hands-on experiments covering many foundational experiments in quantum optics, including two-photon interference, single-photon interferometry, photon correlation functions, state tomography/characterization, and entanglement verification. The candidate will become familiar with tools like lasers, nonlinear optics, and photon detectors, and develop and document data acquisition software to operate the experiments.

Due to COVID-19 restrictions, this role may shift focus to developing online materials and simulations, depending on government and university recommendations and regulations.

The successful candidate will develop an essential skillset for quantum optics research. The selected candidate will also participate in the Undergraduate School on Experiment Quantum Information Processing (USEQIP), to be held virtually throughout the summer, developing a broader knowledge base in quantum information science.
Job Responsibilities:
Building lab apparatuses for quantum education

Through guided research, understand the physical principles and how to realize them in the lab
In the lab, put together and fine-tune/align optical components
Ensure proper working order and robustness through benchmarking tests
Build plug-and-play extensions to core components for educational experiments
Design control and user-end software for both testing and educational use
Assist in the design and editing of lab manuals, student guides, and accompanying video
Required Skills:
Education

Pursuing a university degree in physics.

Experience


200-level or above quantum physics and optics courses are a strong asset.
Prior experience in an optics laboratory is not necessary, but is an asset.

Knowledge/Skills/Abilities


Familiarity with concepts in quantum physics, e.g. superposition, entanglement
Ability to work independently and as part of a research team
Ability to leave detailed and legible lab notes and reports for both supervisors and future users
Expertise working in Python, Mathematica, and/or LabView is an asset (but not essential)
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Scientific Experimental Design and Laboratory Assistance
				
			
				SCI - Physics

Job Title:
NEW
									



										Superconducting Quantum Devices Research Assistant
Job Summary:
A research assistant position for an undergraduate student is available in the Superconducting Quantum Devices (SQD) group. The SQD group (http://research.iqc.uwaterloo.ca/sqd/ ) research focuses on the physics and applications of superconducting devices based on Josephson junctions, with research topics including quantum control in two-level and multi-level systems, decoherence, and light-matter interaction in the strong coupling regime.

The successful candidate will develop an essential skillset for quantum optics research. The selected candidate will also participate in the Undergraduate School on Experiment Quantum Information Processing (USEQIP), to be held virtually throughout the summer, developing a broader knowledge base in quantum information science.
Job Responsibilities:
The position will involve work on designing and developing an experimental setup for experiments with superconducting devices and support for ongoing experiments.

The student will be supervised by Adrian Lupascu (alupascu@uwaterloo.ca ) and work in close collaboration with other researchers.
Required Skills:
The following skills are highly desirable:

CAD 3D software (in particular Autodesk Inventor)
Mechanical design
Electronic design and measurement
Software development, with emphasis on instrument control and data acquisition
Strong background in quantum mechanics and electromagnetism

Education


Pursuing a university degree in physics or electrical engineering
In third-year or above

Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Scientific Experimental Design and Laboratory Assistance
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				SCI - Physics

Job Summary: Teaching Assistants (TAs) are an integral part of our team in WatPD and are the first point of contact for student support in the Professional Development courses. TAs are responsible for supporting students in the completion of their PD courses by answering questions, grading assignments, and providing meaningful feedback. TAs also work on projects with different members of the WatPD staff. Projects are designed to improve specific courses or the WatPD program, and allow TAs to further develop existing skills or to develop new ones. We are dedicated to providing a supportive and dynamic work experience.
Job Responsibilities:
WatPD TAs have the opportunity to support co-op students through email and discussion boards, providing professional and helpful responses to student inquiries. TAs assist students in improving their academic work by providing quality feedback on their assignments. Use your skills and interests to suggest new and innovative projects that are meaningful  and help improve the WatPD program. There is opportunity to develop your own project ideas and then lead and implement these projects throughout the term.
 
Support a group of 25-40 students taking PD1. Mentor and assist students as they make their way through their first co-op search experience, providing in-person meetings to discuss their resume and practice their interview skills. You'll provide feedback on resumes and assessments throughout the term, supporting students  through their work search process.
 
Develop desirable, employable skills through participation in oral presentations, leadership training, and employer networking. Gain and expand on valuable skills needed to succeeed as an employee in all disciplines and work environments such as leadership, problem solving, organizational skills, teamwork, project management, time management, adaptability, communication (written and verbal), and technical skills (Excel, LEARN, digital media tools). Set goals for the term related to workplace, academics, and personal goals for intentional and substantial professional development, preparing you for future work terms.
 
You'll have the opportunity to work with co-op students from many different programs and develop strong relationships and teamwork skills through participation in team building activities.

Note: Applicants MUST have completed at least PD11 or PD12 (formerly PD2) or PD20 to apply

- Genuine interest in helping students
- An understanding of the importance of soft skill development
- Strong written and verbal communication skills
- Excellent organizational and time management skills to manage large class sizes
- Flexibility to manage variations in workload over the term; ability to juggle multiple priorities
- Creativity and initiative to present and implement ideas for course and program improvement

Job Summary:
Do you remember applying to the University of Waterloo? Remember the Waterloo website you spent hours browsing, the admissions viewbook you kept in your room, and the campus pictures on Instagram?
 
Join the team responsible for creating Waterloo's digital and print initiatives for high school students as they apply to university. The Marketing & Undergraduate Recruitment (MUR) team is looking for an outstanding student to support the University's digital communications with high school and transfer students.
 
We are redeveloping our undergraduate programs website and are looking for a strong writer/editor to update and create content as part of that. Here's your chance to contribute to a website that's viewed by 1.7 million people a year.

Job Summary:
Job Title: Outreach and Recruitment Associate
Department: Enrolment and Upper-Year Transitions, St. Jerome's University
Reports to: Manager, Outreach and Recruitment
Employment: May 2021 - August 2021
 
What you'll do:
As the Outreach and Recruitment Associate, you're part of a small but energetic team who works with prospective students to determine if St. Jerome's University is where they want to live, study, and grow. You'll be responsible for planning and implementing outreach and recruitment activities such as You@Waterloo Day, (virtual) campus tours, (online) school visits, TikTok videos, and/or Instagram Stories. You'll also be working with student leaders and staff to oversee the Ambassador Program, and you'll be interacting with future students to answer their questions live, on the phone, through e-mail, and over various interactive web platforms (such as blogs, the SJU website, social media, etc.). It's a fast-paced, people-first environment with multiple projects on the go at any given time through which you will actively contribute to bringing in the next cohort of St. Jerome's University students at the University of Waterloo. Your suggestions, ideas, and innovations are encouraged and empowered as a member of this team.
Job Responsibilities:
A typical day may look like:
- Take, edit, and create photos, videos, and other visual content that can be added to various web platforms (such as what activities students have planned for the summer, including exciting co-ops!).
- Call back a parent of a prospective student who has questions about co-registration between SJU and Waterloo.
- Eat your lunch while playing our classic "SJU Stay at Home Trivia" with staff, faculty, and students.
- Attend a Recruitment Roundtable meeting and share your ideas in preparation for You@Waterloo Day.
- Analyze statistics you gathered in a survey of why current students chose to study at SJU and/or live at SJU.
- Reach out to a Professor in the English Department at SJU to do a quick interview about the exciting online lessons and course they are planning for the Fall (and so you can share it on social media!)
- Partner with the Student Affairs team to create off-campus (online) social events for continuing students 
- Join staff and faculty as they come together (on Zoom) for a weekly coffee time on Friday mornings. A great opportunity to get to know the people that you work alongside!
Required Skills:
This position might be right for you if:
- Your calendar is detailed and colour-coordinated, and you've already mapped out what your next two weeks look like.
- You love having friends over and making sure they have all the food and comfort they need to enjoy themselves.
- You're an enthusiastic member of a team, able to take charge and stand in the spotlight, but are also just as happy to ensure everything is running smoothly behind the scenes.
- You thrive by helping people and by going that extra mile to make sure their interaction with you is a memorable one.
- You love social media and might spend more time that you'd like to admit out loud posting, retweeting, and scrolling through endless TikTok videos.
- You're a self-motivated self-starter who takes initiative to dive into new projects without being asked.
- You are passionate about digital design and digital communication and like creating and editing videos, graphics, and creative content.
- You think creatively and outside the box, but you also know how to pay attention to details and stay focused on your priorities.
 
You might also stand out if you have:
- experience in recruitment, marketing, sales, and/or public speaking
- knowledge of St. Jerome's University and the University of Waterloo
- knowledge of the Kitchener-Waterloo region and culture
- creative skills in fine arts, digital media, photography/video making, and/or writing
- natural and genuine customer service skills
- a strong desire to learn and grow, to ask questions, and to bring your best each day.
 
Why SJU?
Every day we put ourselves in the shoes of our future students to go where they are, understand their needs and wants, and make standard what our competitors consider above and beyond. We challenge ourselves to be 1% better tomorrow than we are today, and we rely on each other to guide and to give that extra push when needed. At the end of the day, we want to raise the profile of the university, and we want to create memorable moments and lasting relationships with our current and future students.  
 
Interested?
We're excited to add your energy and ideas to our team. If you feel you might have only some of the qualifications we're looking for, but you're willing to work hard and learn the rest, we'd still love to see your application!

				- Theme - Marketing and Communication 
				
			
				- Theme - Professional and Technical Writing 
				
			
				- Theme - Sales and Business Development 
				
			
				- Theme - Teaching, Training and Educational Services
				
			
				ARTS - Business

Job Summary:
The Student Success Office (SSO) leads and coordinates student-focused programs and initiatives to promote student success both in and out of the classroom. The role of the SSO's Communications team is to provide strategic communications to support the SSO's objectives, provide leadership to the campus community on student-focused communications, and promote stories of student success.
 
The Digital Communications Assistant supports this work by engaging students on campus and online to foster a sense of community, support, and access to campus resources.
 
During the spring term, the Digital Communications Assistant will also work on new student transition initiatives and support a team of volunteer students leading up to and during Orientation.
 
Required Dates: Spring term co-op only
This position works regular office hours (8:30am-4:30pm), with occasional work outside of office hours from May 10 - September 11 2021.  The shifted start and end dates are to accommodate the co-op student's support during Fall Orientation. If the student is available, they will be asked to work as part-time casual staff (paid) during Orientation week, outside of class hours).
Job Responsibilities:
In this role, you'll get to: 

 
Write content and create an editorial calendar for the @UWaterlooLife Social Media accounts (Instagram, Facebook, and Twitter)
Be the face of the account, introducing weekly content via Instagram Stories and covering events live while they take place (only if on-campus activities resume)
Brainstorm and develop communications plans for the above channels
Provide social media monitoring (reply to direct messages, and comments)
Support social media analytics reporting (weekly and monthly reporting)
Help create and facilitate informative and engaging training sessions for Orientation's Media Team
Provide support with email campaigns (Mailchimp)
Provide support with website content development for student engagement
Collaborate on website, photography, videography and print communication needs
Support a variety of student engagement initiatives that align with our services offered
Coordinate any special projects as assigned
Work with a team of communications and marketing experts who are eager to support your professional development and help you hone your skills
Collaborate with other Student Success Office Co-op students on projects that support the office
Required Skills:
You'll need to: 

Have a strong understanding of social media platforms and experience creating engaging social media content for Instagram, Facebook, and Twitter - Bonus points if you're an Instagram stories/Reels master
Experience and strong comfort level being in front of the camera and acting as the face of our social media accounts for the term
Have demonstrated writing and editing skills
Experience with photography, video filming or editing (or show a strong interest in this area)
Experience with graphic design or visual content creation (Adobe Creative Suite, Canva, etc.)
Have excellent communication and organization skills
Have strong Microsoft Office experience
Be able to manage several projects concurrently, prioritize tasks and meet deadlines
Be self-motivated with the ability to work without regular supervision and in a virtual format depending on the future of on-campus vs remote work environment


It would be nice if you had: 

Experience with content calendars and social campaign development
Experience with content management systems (Wordpress, Blogger, Waterloo CMS, etc.)
Experience with social influencers and understanding why/how they become influential

										Student Relations and Front Desk Assistant
Job Summary:
The Student Success Office (SSO) leads and coordinates various student-focused programs and initiatives which promote student success.  On a daily basis, many students, staff, faculty and community members contact and visit the SSO to obtain information about programs and resources offered by the SSO.  The Student Relations & Front Desk Assistant's role is crucial to the smooth operation of the office.  As a front-line staff member, the Student Relations & Front Desk Assistant is responsible for providing information, resources and outstanding customer service to students, staff, faculty, and parents who visit and contact the SSO.  In addition, the successful candidate will provide general administrative and clerical support to the entire office as required.

Please note that the Student Success Office may continue to be closed due to the COVID-19 pandemic. This job may require you to work remotely from your home location. You must have access to a computer, reliable internet, and a work from home space.
Job Responsibilities:
- Provide outstanding and professional front line customer service to all individuals who contact the Student Success Office
- Direct students and visitors to the appropriate resources
- Book, cancel and monitor appointments
- Monitor the success@uwaterloo.ca email address and respond to all inquiries
- Answer phone calls, check the voicemail, respond to all incoming inquiries and transfer calls to the appropriate resource
- Provide resources and information to the campus community regarding events, services, and programs
- Use knowledge of university and resource skills to direct/refer SSO visitors to the correct offices/services outside of the SSO
- Observe daily interactions, concerns, and general inquiries and suggest ways for SSO to improve interactions with students
- Record and track daily in-office activity and produce monthly reports outlining activity, trends and suggestions for improvement
- Responsible for opening and closing the office each day
- Complete multiple housekeeping tasks, including distributing mail, ordering supplies, and keeping the workspace tidy
- Assist in the planning and implementation of special events and professional development sessions
- Attend staff meetings and professional development opportunities
- Assist in any additional office tasks as assigned
Required Skills:
- Superior customer service skills and strong team player
- Excellent communication skills, verbal and written
- Excellent interpersonal skills and willingness to help students, faculty, and staff from a variety of cultures
- Knowledge of the University of Waterloo's services and programs
- Detail oriented and ability to multi-task and prioritize tasks and deadlines
- Enjoy working with people and possess a friendly and outgoing personality
- Self-motivator, ability to work without constant supervision

Job Summary:
The Student Success Office (SSO) is hiring three Co-op students to support the Waterloo Ready Peer Mentorship program. The Waterloo Ready Peer Mentorship Program is a program designed to support incoming first year students by:

welcoming them to the Waterloo community
supporting their transition to university life
connecting them to services and resources
facilitating peer to peer relationships
building community and belonging in a virtual environment

Through this program, first-year students will join a virtual community with approximately 30 other first year students from the same faculty, allowing participants to meet their peers and build connections before classes begin. This virtual community will be led by an upper year student mentor, also from the same faculty. Mentors will act as a resource by answering questions, sharing personal experiences about transition and UWaterloo life, and providing proactive peer support. Mentors will also facilitate synchronous weekly meetings and develop activities and social programming for their group of students.
 
Waterloo Ready Program Assistants (WRPA) will help oversee all aspects of the peer mentorship program, with a strong emphasis on program logistics,  administration, coordination and communications. Each Co-op student will oversee a group of peer mentors, in which they will be the main point of contact for the peers. WRPA will support training of the peer leaders, program, content development, email communications, technical support, trouble shooting, and assessment and evaluation. These positions will support the retention of incoming students through the initiatives/programming they will support over the summer months.
Working as a Waterloo Ready Program Assistant during the Spring 2021 term is a fantastic way to support our incoming first year students, as well as develop your leadership, teamwork, communication, and project management skills.
Job Responsibilities:
Waterloo Ready Program Assistants may be expected to perform some or all the following duties:

Job Title:
NEW
									



										New Student Transition Programs Assistant
Job Summary:
The Student Success Office (SSO) coordinates the supportive transition of new undergraduate students to the University of Waterloo. The SSO is hiring one New Student Transition (NST) Programs Assistant to support the successful implementation of virtual transition programs for incoming new students and their families, with a particular focus on Waterloo Ready.

Waterloo Ready is an integrated online program for all incoming undergraduate students that takes place throughout the summer prior to their first term of studies. This program is designed to address the following topics to support a student's successful transition and decrease their anxieties around starting their studies at UWaterloo in the fall:
- Academic preparedness
- Learning in an online environment
- Building a sense of community

The NST Programs Assistant is accountable to the New Student Transition Project Coordinator and will work with all members of the New Student Transition team to ensure a smooth transition experience for new incoming University of Waterloo undergraduate students. The NST Programs Assistant will support two major components of Waterloo Ready including the faculty specific LEARN courses, as well the Waterloo Ready Live Chats.

The NST Programs Assistant will administer aspects of these programs including LEARN course management and design, communications support, and logistics, including scheduling, training, and execution of virtual live chats. They will support, content development, email communications, technical support, trouble shooting, and assessment and evaluation as it pertains to the transition initiatives they are involved with. They will work closely with stakeholders in the SSO and across campus to ensure program success.

Additionally, the NST Programs Assistant will assist with the administrative preparation and tasks for parent and supporter programming, as well as Transfer and Exchange, American and Out-of-Province, and First-year orientation programming.
 
On a daily basis, the NST Programs Assistant will be responsible for providing outstanding and professional service by answering questions via email from new students and their family members as well as campus partners. The NST Programs Assistant must have knowledge of the University of Waterloo, and the Student Success Office, and feel confident in this customer relations capacity. 
The NST Programs Assistant will need to take initiative, be creative and flexible, and possess the ability to work independently as well as with others. This will require clear analytical thinking and excellent interpersonal skills. For this role, successful candidates will need to possess effective time management and organizational skills, as well as strong communication and leadership qualities.
Working as the NST Programs Assistant during the Spring 2021 term is a fantastic way to support our incoming first year students, as well as develop your leadership, teamwork, communication, and project management skills.
Job Responsibilities:
The NST Programs Assistant may be expected to perform some or all the following duties:

Oversee all administrative aspects of the Waterloo Ready LEARN courses including content development and course management, focusing on enhancing student engagement and creating an interactive online transition course.
Oversee all administrative aspects of the Waterloo Ready Live Chats including scheduling, content review, technical support, transcription of recorded events and posting of transcribed events to appropriate LEARN courses.
Manage databases with sensitive data, collect feedback from stake holders, and provide comprehensive program documentation.
Provide support to student and staff volunteers including scheduling, training and trouble shooting for online virtual events.
Manage the New Student Transition email account and respond to inquiries in a timely manner.
Provide excellent customer service online, and on the phone to students, staff and families regarding new student transition initiatives.
Be knowledgeable about the UWaterloo community and stay up to date with services and programs available to students.
Participate in and contribute to regular team meetings, training, and professional development.
Complete a program summary report and offer recommendations for future program development and delivery.
Assist the New Student Transition team during Orientation in an administrative and logistical capacity.
Support additional projects and initiatives across the SSO as they arise.
Evening and weekend work will be required; lieu time will be provided for time worked.
Required Skills:
Genuine interest in helping students transition from a high school environment to the University of Waterloo
Familiarity with online learning technology (LEARN, digital media tools), productivity software (Microsoft Office), and teleconferencing technology (Microsoft Teams, Zoom, Cisco WebEx).
Strong interpersonal skills including written and verbal communication skills.
Excellent attention to detail, organization and time management skills.
Flexibility to manage variations in workload over the term; ability to juggle multiple priorities and competing tasks.
Creativity and initiative to propose and implement ideas for delivering programming online and improving the student experience.
Adaptability and resilience to deal with volatility and uncertainty.
Self-motivated and high level of autonomy.
Knowledge of the University of Waterloo's services and programs.
Ability to problem solving, trouble shoot and think creatively.  
Experience working in higher education student support is an asset.
Experience coordinating projects and executing processes is an asset.

Job Title:
NEW
									



										Campaign Coordinator, University of Waterloo United Way Campaign
Job Summary:
General Accountability
The campaign coordinator plays a key role in impacting the Waterloo Region communities by supporting the United Way committee's fundraising goals. The role provides effective fundraising coordination, operational consistency, intentional communications and public relations support for the campaign. The campaign coordinator is accountable to the Administrative Officer and works closely with a group of core committee members to facilitate campaign planning (May-August) and execution/support (September-December) as well as administrative and clerical tasks associated with running the University of Waterloo United Way Campaign. Office location: MC 2010.
Job Responsibilities:
Nature and Scope
The campaign coordinator works an average of 35 hours per week for 8 months (May-December). Some flexibility is necessary, as the weeks immediately before and during the official campaign are particularly hectic. Although the official campaign is tentatively scheduled to run the entire month of October, the planning for it, led by volunteers from across campus, takes place year-round. The campaign coordinator works independently, with telephone and computer access to the core committee members, volunteers, and donors.

Specific Accountabilities
Work in cooperation with the campaign co-chairs, administrative officer, and volunteer campaign team to facilitate Campaign Planning (May-August) and Campaign Execution/Support (September-December).
 
Campaign Planning (May-August)

Analyze data from current and the previous years' campaigns to assist in developing strategies to increase engagement and enhance stewardship for donors and volunteers
Navigate campaign tools (i.e. e-Pledge) and produce reports for planning purposes as requested; proficiency in Excel would be an asset
Update website content such as: homepage, donation procedures, and volunteer content
Prepare campaign materials such as: pledge forms, solicitation letters, campaign communication materials, volunteer training materials, emails, and campaign promotions for the University's Daily Bulletin
Assist with the planning and execution of events such as the President's United Way kickoff luncheon, Volunteer Training Session, Souper Lunch, as well as virtual events such as cooking shows and collaborations with departments across campus.
Enhance the structure of departmental ambassadors (volunteers) across campus through a calling and/or email campaign
Be a source of support for ambassadors (volunteers) throughout the campaign; keep information and resources up-to-date
Schedule regularly occurring meetings with core committee members; learn the requirements for your role, prepare campaign material as requested
Primary communicator with all core committee members, ambassadors (volunteers), donors; must be proficient in verbal and written communications
Create and manage a critical path, update existing logical process documents and procedure manuals; strong organization and attention to detail required 

Campaign Execution/Support (September-December)

Answer phone and email inquiries from core committee members, donors, and the United Way Waterloo Region Communities (WRC) campaign team professionally and in a timely manner
Manage the campaign budget, keeping all receipts and conducting monthly reconciliations
Schedule regular core committee meetings; send reminders, prepare meeting agendas and write minutes
Communicate with our ambassadors via MS Teams, send weekly newsletters, update volunteer toolkit materials
Process daily mail, primarily donation and pledge forms
Balance donations and campaign database via e-Pledge, United Way WRC's online donation system, along with balancing and depositing cash on a daily or weekly basis
Produce statistical reports for core committee members, United Way WRC, and departmental representatives as requested (discretion is required as some information is confidential)
Manage communications and public relations activities, including press releases, flyers, web site maintenance, e-newsletter content, and mass emails
Keep up-to-date records of special events across campus; create advertisements, take photos, and manage photography for our website.
Liaise with staff from across campus for success in promoting this campaign to the entire community
Create critical path for the following year's actions and tasks based on learning and outcomes of current campaign
Other duties as assigned
Required Skills:
Qualifications

In-depth experience working with large data sets and proven knowledge of database management; proven ability to accurately complete detailed work
Working knowledge of Excel, Outlook, Word and web-site maintenance (WCMS training will be available)
Detail oriented
Exceptional time management skills with the ability to switch tasks effectively while staying organized
Strong organizational skills with the ability to adapt to changing circumstances
Proficient interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills required
Ability to work independently, yet know when to consult
Experience with handling cash
Proven ability to maintain confidentiality
Possess a friendly, co-operative attitude
Ability to work from home and work on campus a few times each week depending on the circumstances of COVID-19

Assets
Experience with volunteer management, public relations, event planning, communications, and database management

Job Summary:
Job Summary 
 
The Community Relations and Events team supports the University's strategic goals through developing and executing an outstanding suite of programs, events and partnerships to positively position and build the reputation and impact of the University of Waterloo both within our community and abroad.   

This co-op placement will provide an enthusiastic candidate with the opportunity to play a dynamic role in the University of Waterloo's central community relations and events office. The communications and Events Assistant will provide assistance and support for the implementation of communications and events agenda for the University of Waterloo.
  
This position will offer experience in communications, event planning (virtual, with the possibility for hybrid events) and production, streaming and video editing, community engagement, and communications. The candidate will play a support role in Spring Convocation and many other campus-wide events. The ability to be proactive and an independent worker while still collaborating within a team is an asset that will help the Community Relations and Events Assistant.

This is a 4-month work term.
Job Responsibilities:
Job Responsibilities
 
The successful candidate will undertake a number of projects and responsibilities including:

Assist in the creation and implementation of campaigns promoting events and the reputation of the University of Waterloo
Drafting and/or editing event invitations, registrations, reminder emails, and all other event related communication materials
Support and participate in the planning and execution of a number of signature University of Waterloo events such as convocation, employee recognition events, presidential transition events, and community lectures.
Compose notes, capturing key messages, and provide content for event related promotions
Responsible for maintaining and updating strategic communication tools and tracking databases such as Airtable
Support the creation and editing of event videos
Assist with management of online streaming events
Support the pre-planning for a number of key initiatives through the use of various event-planning tools such as; work-back schedules, scenarios, and cue sheets
Execute on a number of events through on-site and off-site support; including management of the event day inbox
Act as an ambassador for the University in all community settings which may include; public, government, at any special events.
Effectively manage event inventory requests and organization of collateral.
Perform public relations, communications, marketing/advertising, and administrative duties as required.
Required Skills:
Required Skills
 
The successful candidate must demonstrate:
           

The student must be a highly skilled writer, with a good understanding of digital platforms (website / social media)
Exceptional written and verbal communications skills, excellent editing skills
Event planning experience is an asset
WCMS training and experience, would be considered an asset
Experience with creating, or editing videos (Adobe Suite) is an asset
Consistently able to meet deadlines
Ability to work both independently and as part of a team
Keen analytical skills, with an eye for attention to detail
Experience with streaming online events would be considered an asset
Ability to proactively and creatively solve problems
Committed to both personal and professional growth and actively seeks out opportunities for development
Ability to adapt to a changing environment and handle multiple priorities

 
This position may require work in the evenings and/or weekends on occasion to execute special events

Two writing samples (no more than 500 words) must be provided upon application.

Job Summary:
Untether AI is a rapidly growing Toronto startup building a next generation hardware AI accelerator for neural net inference. We're designing integrated circuits that will run neural nets orders of magnitude faster, while using less power. This class of chips will be the standard platform for running image recognition, speech synthesis, text-to-speech, and many other applications in data centres, mobile phones, and self-driving cars within the next 5 years.

As we work on enabling our accelerator in the SW for our end users, we are looking for help from self-motivated and innately curious SW candidates to join our Runtime team. In this role, you will help us architect and implement key aspects of our production compute drivers, their APIs, and the corresponding toolchain. You will craft elegant solutions to exciting problems and form the future direction of our system software, and how our accelerator will be used by our users.

We encourage interdisciplinarity and learning, so if you have experience spanning hardware and software, come talk with us. But don't worry if you think your experience is too narrowly focused - we've got great projects for people with a wide range of interests and specializations.
Job Responsibilities:
Join our Runtime team and learn about our exciting software projects. These projects expose you to how software interacts with hardware and offer exciting challenges for you to tackle. In this role, from a high-level, you will help us:

- design, develop and verify software that interacts with our chip; collaborate with hardware engineers and fellow software engineers
- characterize the performance of various components of our runtime software stack and devise relevant optimization ideas
- identify functional/performance bottlenecks and alleviate them in order to achieve scalable and reliable software
- Architect low and high level API for internal and external users
Required Skills:
We don't have strict skill requirements, but of course prior experience in the tools and skills we use is a plus:

- Tools and programming languages we use: C, C++, Git
- Topics we are interested in include: operating systems, system software, scalable and reliable software design, virtualization technologies
- Skills we are looking for: good data structures and algorithms knowledge, experience with performance analysis, and high and low-level software optimization
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				- Theme - Computing: Systems Security and Cryptography 
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Systems Design and Biomedical Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Combinatorics and Optimization
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science
				
			
				MATH - Computing and Financial Management
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
Untether AI is a rapidly growing Toronto startup building a next generation hardware AI accelerator for neural net inference. We're designing integrated circuits that will run neural nets orders of magnitude faster, while using less power. This class of chips will be the standard platform for running image recognition, speech synthesis, text-to-speech, and many other applications in data centers, mobile phones, and self driving cars within the next 5 years.

As we prepare our next chip design for tape out, our hardware design work is focused on a few primary areas:

The design of the control systems for the AI accelerator in hardware description languages (e.g. VHDL, verilog)
The design of verification programs (using cocotb or UVM for example)
The design of the custom circuitry for our AI accelerator engine. This includes design and simulation at both the analog and logic level
The design of a circuit boards to support and run the chip within different customer applications
Integrating harware simulation models with our software systems for design validation

We are looking for self motivated and innately curious candidates. You can expect to be put in a charge of an important project that will challenge you to learn, and you will be provided with mentoring and guidance from veteran hardware engineers. Because we're building new systems from the ground up, you'll get to work on new unsolved problems.

We encourage interdisciplinarity and learning, so if you have experience in hardware or software, come talk to us. But don't worry if you think your experience is too narrowly focused, we've got great projects for people with a wide range of interests and specializations.
Job Responsibilities:
Join our team and come learn about our hardware and software projects. You can pick your own project from a large number of topics, and we'll work together to set the deliverables for your term with us. In general, expect to work in a loose SCRUM like environment (weekly/biweekly work sprint with code deliverable) where you are submitting your designs or code for team review via git merge/pull request or group presentation.

Some examples of tasks:

Evaluate competing hardware designs' performance or tolerances via SPICE or RTL level simulations
Exactly reproduce the behaviour of a piece of digital logic in the chip (logic gates, muxes, registers) in simulation code (python or C)
Help write verilog HDL for custom microprocessors
Implement the verilog in FPGA for evaluation prior to silicon
Write Python code to test chip in a system
Required Skills:
We don't have strict skill requirements, but of course prior experience in the tools and skills we use is a plus:

Tools and programming languages we use: cadence, synopsys (VCS, dc-shell, primetime), spice, verilog, VHDL, python, cocotb, git, icarus, verilator
Topics and skills we are interested in include: cpu design, dsp design, artificial intelligence, neural net training and inference, digital logic design and analysis
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Hardware
				
			
				- Theme - Computing: Information Systems

				- Theme - Information Science and Data Management 
				
			
				- Theme - Professional and Technical Writing

				MATH - Computer Science

Job Summary:
Upchain is a cloud PLM solution that simplifies product development by connecting engineers, designers, project managers, and other crucial product stakeholders throughout the lifecycle. With us, product innovation is easier than ever before. Manage changes, view CAD files in 3D, and capture feedback and approvals from any stakeholder using a single, simple platform. We currently have 70 employees working from 2 locations in Croatia and the Head Office in Toronto. In 2019  Upchain Inc., received Deloitte Technology Fast 50 Companies-to-Watch award. The award spotlights emerging companies that exhibit strong growth and show potential to be a future candidate for the Technology Fast 50 award.

By joining and integrating with our Toronto-based platform architecture team, you'll be helping us build a scalable, performant, extendable SaaS platform that will do for physical product design and manufacturing what GitHub did for software design and development. Help us transform the industry that still runs in silos, where clear communication is facilitated by spreadsheets and where a single source of truth does not exist.
Job Responsibilities:
Work on a scrum team and follow agile principles
Actively participate in architectural discussions. Write code that is well-designed, testable and efficient. Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to these problems
Work with a product manager to ensure that each task is delivered according to business requirements
Work on documenting and improving architecture best practices for Scrum teams to follow
Required Skills:
Knowledge of Algorithms & Experience with back-end technologies: Java 8/11, Spring Boot, RESTful API design
Experience with database technologies: SQL, Hibernate, Redis
Familiarity with DevOps practices and infrastructure technologies: AWS, Terraform, Ansible, Jenkins
Familiarity with Design Patterns, Web Services and Object-Oriented Programming Technologies and Concepts
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Systems Design and Biomedical Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science

Job Summary:
Our team has spent the last 10+ years helping high-growth SaaS enterprises solve knowledge and revenue problems with technology. We've learned that industry needs reach much deeper than that - education for sales professionals is falling short of what modern-day technology companies demand, and it's nearly impossible for skilled professionals from other industries to break in. We've launched Uvaro to solve this, and we're looking for a Digital Marketing Co-Op to help build on and execute this vision. 

That's where you come in! If you are looking to work in a fast-paced, highly collaborative environment focused on the leading edge of education and technology, then we should talk. We are looking for an energetic, results-oriented and well-organized team player to join our marketing team!

If you are goal-driven, thrive in a fast-paced environment, and are ready to make a huge impact in a growing company, we would love to hear from you.
Job Responsibilities:
In this role you'll:

Create digital ad and social media graphics and copy
Coordinate and measure online campaigns
Update web pages, links, and meta information to help us juice our SEO
Contribute to our social media accounts and engage with our online community
Represent the Uvaro brand at online events
Analyze the performance of of our advertising, social media and owned media
Ensure we present a consistent voice across various content channels

In this first 6 months you'll:

Work closely with our marketing, sales, and instructional teams to create great content in support of our students

Job Summary:
At Uplift, we're passionate about making travel more accessible, affordable and rewarding for everyone. Through our flexible Buy Now, Pay Later solution, we're changing the way people book, buy, and experience travel. It isn't easy to build an enterprise solution that meets the tough demands of some of the world's leading brands, but we love a good challenge. We've been in high growth mode since our Series C round of funding but we still hold on to the values that have inspired our mission since the beginning; innovation, diversity, agility, and a love for travel. If our mission inspires you, let's talk!
 
Uplift partners with top travel brands such as the vacations sites of United, American, Southwest, cruise lines such as Carnival and Norwegian, theme parks such as Universal, and many more. Learn more at www.uplift.com.
Job Responsibilities:
-Design, build and maintain data pipelines in cloud infrastructure (AWS), using Python, Databricks Spark, Snowflake and Airflow
-Build Python libraries, tools, serverless applications and workflows
-Internal process improvements such as automating manual processes, building alerting/monitoring to ensure data quality
-Work with analysts and data scientists to extract actionable insights from data that shape the direction of the company
-Actively engage in design and code reviews - learn from your peers and teach your peers
Required Skills:
-Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining a degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field
-Solid coder in Python, Bash, and SQL
-Experience with cloud data warehouse, preferably Snowflake, and Apache Spark
-Familiar with Linux, AWS, and Docker
-Entrepreneurial, persistent, with the desire to go deep in details
-Excellent interpersonal, cross-functional, communication
-Comfortable working in a startup culture with the ability to earn trust

				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				- Theme - Data Analytics, Statistical Analysis and Mathematical Optimization

Job Summary:
Uplift Pay Monthly was founded by a passionate team of travel industry veterans to make travel more accessible, affordable, and rewarding for everyone. By offering simple, flexible payments, Uplift helps travelers book early while prices are low, and pay for their trip over time. Uplift is a well-financed Series C startup serving the $1.4 Trillion consumer travel segment.

Uplift partners with top travel brands such as the vacations sites of United, American, Southwest, cruise lines such as Carnival, theme parks such as Universal, and many more. Learn more at www.uplift.com.

Uplift interns will work alongside the talented engineers on projects to deliver significant impact to the company. Some of the work involves creating full-stack applications and serverless applications that handle financial operations like automating payments and creating virtual credit cards. We'll also pair you with a mentor in the team, but you can find a mentor anywhere in the company!
Job Responsibilities:
- Create and interface with various internal and external micro-services, queues, and key-value store
- Develop interactive single-page web applications
- Develop API endpoints, application servers and lambdas that connect with various AWS services, external APIs, and data stores
- Building readable, product level code and reusable libraries
- Help out in other areas of software development including tooling, devops, and analytics
Required Skills:
- Currently has, or in the process of obtaining a Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science, Computer -Engineering, or a related degree
- Past internship experience(s) is a plus
- Proficient coding in either Python or Java
- Knowledge working with databases (DynamoDB, postgres, etc)
- Familiar with developing in a cloud service environment (AWS) is a plus
- Entrepreneurial, persistent, with the desire to go deep into the details
- Comfortable working in a startup culture with the ability to earn trust

Job Summary:
About us:
Uptake Canada delivers solutions that enable industrial equipment dealerships to increase productivity, reliability, and safety. Uptake Canada formed in 2016 when Uptake, a leading predictive analytics provider, purchased Canam Solutions Inc., a provider of enterprise workflow software for industrial equipment dealerships. Uptake aggregates asset, enterprise, and external data and applies cross-industry data science to produce high-value, actionable insights.

As a member of one of our QA Team, the Software Tester will work in a fast-paced environment with a group of over fifty software, service, and sales professionals to create, enhance and support testing activities on the web and mobile applications for our customers.
Job Responsibilities:
As a Software Tester, your responsibilities may include, but are not limited to, the following:

Increasing our test coverage, build and maintain test case suites
Work as a fully engaged member of a SCRUM team, testing stories developed in the sprint
Support all testing activities related to manual and automation testing of stories developed in the sprint
Develop product knowledge of the application and use this knowledge to uncover defects and drive up test coverage
Create and execute test plans consisting of functional, system, regression and integration test suites
Build and maintain the test case, author test cases for various types of testing that will cover mobile applications, web applications and REST API
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with ability to work effectively in team-oriented collaborative environment
Perform system level regression testing to ensure product readiness for release cycles
Work with Product stakeholders and engineers to ensure all the aspects of the application have proper test coverage and overall system reliability, performance and quality standards are met
Required Skills:
The ideal candidate would have the following:

A passion for Software testing and an understanding that testing is not one person or one team's responsibility
Experience in testing applications built on architecture supporting cloud computing architecture
Understanding of object-oriented programming (Java)
Experienced with JIRA, Git and Bitbucket
Outstanding problem-solving skills
Ability to work quickly and collaboratively in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment
Ability to demonstrate ownership and accountability through self-directed task management
Good verbal and written communication skills in English
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Quality Assurance 
				
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
Urbantech is a growing civil engineering consulting firm located in the City of Markham. We strive to consistently provide superior quality municipal design, construction administration, project management and water resources engineering consulting services.
 
We are looking for a highly motivated student to work as an integral member of the construction administration team. This dynamic individual must be able to work effectively in a team environment. The individual's prime responsibility will be providing field inspection support of land development projects, throughout the GTHA. Responsibilities will escalate given the individual's technical proficiency and desire to excel. Urbantech has hired over 50 co-op students and counting with 8 becoming full time hires. As Urbantech continues to grow, this intern opportunity may lead to a full-time position.

Urbantech has various jobsites located throughout the GTHA. The successful candidates will likely be work on jobsites within Oakville, Milton, Brampton, Caledon, Pickering and Bradford. Specific locations will be confirmed as the Co-Op start date approaches.

For more information on Urbantech, visit our newly updated website at www.urbantech.com or connect with us on social media!
Job Responsibilities:
Specific duties would include:

1. Provide field inspection of storm, sanitary and watermain installations.
2. Provide field inspection of road construction.
3. Provide field inspection of utility installation.
4. Inspect and record earth moving operations.
5. Be responsible for completing as constructed surveys.
6. Perform quantity take-offs while assisting in the preparation of tenders and contract documents.
 
Urbantech will strive to provide the successful candidate exposure to all aspects of the construction administration process.
Required Skills:
The successful candidate should have:

Enthusiasm and a keen interest in municipal engineering.
Strong interpersonal communications skills.
Be independent.
Excellent planning and organization abilities.
Able to provide a reliable vehicle with a valid G2/G level licence to conduct site visits across the GTHA.  

We are looking for a team player that is up for the task presented to them!
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Construction and Infrastructure Development 
				
			
				- Theme - Waste or Wastewater Management 
				
			
				ENG - Civil, Environmental and Geological Engineering
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report
